Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience, all around!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria_BCTall_Guy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this beautiful hotel for a conference in the middle of April, for 4 days and thought it was fantastic. I was greeted by the doorman and whenever we came and went, the doors were opened for us. The folks behind the front desk always had a smile and were so kind and professional - it's nice to see. They're doing it right, here! I had an upgraded room on the 33rd floor facing West (overlooking the Canadiens arena and train station). It looked like it was brand-new so I'm guessing they recently renovated. Our conference required the use of multiple meeting rooms (for meals, presentations, receptions etc) and all of the rooms were perfectly suited for their purpose. The grand ballroom downstairs suited our function perfectly and the Cafe Conc was excellent as well - one of the most unique spaces I've ever been in - it's a tiered/auditorium style seating area with a large stage at the front, allowing you to listen to a speaker/entertainment while enjoying your meal. Turns out, this place has quite a bit of history to it to boot - just ask any of the staff. As for location - I found it to be excellent, personally. Close to shopping, dining and the train station. The Starbucks and retail arcade off the lobby was beneficial as well. The only thing I did not get to try was the pool/gym area. Our conference kept us a little to busy for that. I would definitely choose this hotel again and can't wait for the opportunity to do so. I encourage others to as well - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed”
Reviews.Author: euphamia
Reviews.Content: I went to a conference and had the pleasure of staying at this hotel. From check in to check out it was amazing. The perfect combination of professionalism and friendliness. The rooms are well appointed and very very clean with a spectacular view on the city. Congratulations on an excellent housekeeping staff. The food was amazing which is saying a lot when it comes to banquet food. Every meal was a treat for the senses. The all of the serving staff were fantastic but i do have to say that Jose was my favorite. There were over 100 attendees and yet he remembered me and what my preferences were especially with wine. Had a very quite sense of humor that made you feel welcome and special. While there are lots of restaurants in the area do try theirs. You will not be disappointed. We did get some free time and this location is perfect for walking to Old Montreal, St Catherines and Sherbrooke Street. I highly recommend this property if you are going to Montreal for business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: DAB8899
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently undergone renovations to the guestrooms and the results are fantastic. Wonderful beds with comfy pillows and a cosy duvet but best of all a reading light on the headboard. The desk was large and functional. Of course the view was to die for! The hotel is centrally located within walking distance of the train station, St. Catherine Street for shopping and old Montreal. The staff are outstanding - very welcoming and helpful no matter what time of day you see them. I will be back again on my next visit to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location with a beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Lisa3333333333333333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Montreal Marriott on Sunday and had one of the best hotel experiences in a long time. Self parking was available and I much prefer this over valet. The man working at the front desk was very accommodating when I asked for a room on a high floor, even though we booked through a third party website. The view was absolutely gorgeous and the half moon shaped windows that have been mentioned many times on the reviews are just beautiful. The bell boy was very friendly, helpful and genuine, thanks Samuel! Everyone we encountered was very polite and professional. At the Montreal Marriott you are actually treated like a valued guest. The location was great. It was about a 5 minute walk to Crescent street. This is the only place I will stay in downtown Montreal. Stay here: you'll be happy you did!

Reviews.Title: “4 1/2 stars - Marriott Chateau Champlain”
Reviews.Author: mbclifford
Reviews.Content: When you walk into the lobby of this commanding building in Montreal you are immediately met with a sense of history. If the walls could talk I am sure that there would be lots of stories of the people and groups that have stayed at the property. The location is very good - a quick walk to the canals with the bike paths that lead you all over this lovely city, a very quick walk to the hustle and bustle of St. Catherine's Street, and a nice stroll to Old Montreal. One discovery during this trip was a very brief elevator ride to 'Underground Montreal' and all of the passageways and walkways to the circuitous shopping and dining venues. There are a number of eating establishments in walking distance above ground as well - not to mention a short block walk to the Bell Center. The people here are great - the breakfast buffet had a decent selection and our room (Room 2911) was as quiet as can be. We will definitely plan to stay at the Chateau Champlain again - and would recommend it to others with enthusiasm!

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff, clean hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: KingmanP
Reviews.Content: Stayed that for the weekend, and was felt very welcomed right away as I arrived midnight Friday. This is not the first time I've stayed in this hotel but it is the first time I provided feedback. Got a room with a decent view. While I was there over the weekend, the hotel was quiet, and that is a huge plus for me. The executive lounge is also very nice but unfortunately they are not open during the weekends. However, they do compensate for the inconvenience by letting you dine in their restaurant for breakfast, which offers great breakfast selection. I also felt the hotel staff is friendlier this time around, not sure if they have changed since I stayed there last year, but I hope it wasn't a coincidence. The location is good, close to the train station, close to downtown St. Catherine, but also far enough away from the main crowd to be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms strange layout and mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: kimfamilyof4
Reviews.Content: I went here for a conference in Feb 2012. I stayed in a double and the room size is nice. The room was facing the courtyard. The entire hotel is a strange layout. As far as I'm aware there is only two elevators to take you out. By lunch time the was a huge line of people waiting to use it. The service was mediocre. When I checked in the front desk didn't give me clear directions to get to my room and the layout is a little confusing. I also to ask the concierge a question and after waiting for a while the person walked away right when I got to the desk without even mentioning if he was coming back. Otherwise the hotel is very conveniently located. The hotel restaurant food was good with some originality in their menu. I didn't find the place to be extraordinary but average.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel, great location needs upgrading”
Reviews.Author: brooklintravel
Reviews.Content: great location but hotel seems dated. I prefer the Hilton, which is next door and has a much better atmosphere. I will continue to stay to collect the points. The bed was comfortable and room was clean. The only complaint I had is that most Marriott's have a large bottle of water on the desk and this was not available in the room. I was on the 27th floor with nice view of downtown. Parking is not as versatile as other downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chris726
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Montreal on February 2nd for my annual Montreal Canadians weekend. This was my first stay at the Marriott Chateau Champlain and I was very impressed! I had a room on the 25th floor which overlooked beautiful downtown Montreal and the park, I would suggest a room on this side of the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, which made the stay all the better. What sets this hotel apart from most is it's connection to the underground tunnel network. It was great for us because we could walk to the Bell Centre in our t-shirts underground. There is a Starbucks down in the main lobby which is great for a coffee & a breakfast sandwich in the morning. If your in the mood for a more hearty breakfast, a 5 minute walk in the underground tunnel system will take you to a variety of restaurants to choose from. The Chateau Champlain is centrally located, just minutes from St. Caterine street, restaurants, shopping, old Montreal etc. I will be staying here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SIGNALS123
Reviews.Content: We took our family to Montreal for a weekend stay to enjoy the city and to see a Hockey Game at the Bell Centre. The hotel was only a short 1 block walk above ground from the Bell Centre which made it very convenient. The rooms were spacious, well appointed and very bright. The two rooms we rented were adjacent rooms, but not connecting rooms on the 23rd floor. High enough to sample the vista of the nearby park area and eliminate any traffic noise. We had breakfast the one day and for a buffet it was okay, but was missing the personal touch of an omelet station. The connection to the Montreal underground made it very convenient to travel on the Metro. Unfortunately the heating of the pool was being repaired so our grandchildren didn't get a chance to swim, which was one of the reasons we choose this hotel. All in all we enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ComeauTeam
Reviews.Content: Our family of four recently stayed at the Chateau Mariott for a habs vs. leafs game and were very impressed. The underground tunnel which connects the hotel to the Bell Centre was a huge plus! Despite the hotel being fully booked on game day the high level of service continued. This place is a well oiled machine and they know how to treat their patrons. The concierges, reception and cleaning staff were all cordial. Rooms were large (we had two connecting queen bed rooms) with a great layout between bedrooms and bath. Overall very pleased with this hotel, will return we are in Montreal next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncm7772
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location. Just a block or so away from the Bell Centre and about a mile from the heart of downtown Montreal (about $9 cab ride). Again, great location. Beautiful lobby, well everything in the hotel was beautiful. Room was great, spacious, with a great view of the city. All ameneties worked fine. On site parking for a reasonable fee. The reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 are two aspects that you may not think of much, but really irritated me. First off, get your valet to explain things better. He tried to explain the parking situation about 4 times, before I finally asked him to stop and told him I'd figure it out myself. He could have said, "You park yourself for X dollars, or we park you for X dollars", instead he spoke like a moron. Check in took forEVER. There were people in front of me who also took a while to check in. I personally was at the counter for about 10 minutes, even though I had a reservation, and all they needed to do was swipe my credit card and have me sign. Also, the directions in the hotel are poor. When you take the elevator from the garage into the hotel, it brings you to one of the other areas in the building (there are businesses, stores, etc in addition to the hotel), and there are virtually no signs or directions BACK to the hotel. Was difficult to find our room. Poor planning. Overall, if you can handle those small headaches, it's a great hotel. Everything is clean, comfortable, and in excellent working order.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and warm...”
Reviews.Author: ColoMoon
Reviews.Content: It was extremely cold when I arrived in Montreal,and was looking for a nice warm room and a hot shower, and this property more than satisfied the request for my 2 night stay while on business. Yes this may be an older building but as soon as you enter the lobby you will know are in for a nice stay. Very efficient staff at the front desk, got the king room as requested, as well as the location (hi floor, away from elevator). The heater in the room worked flawlessly, hot water flowed freely in the shower, and everything in the room was in perfect working order. Situated in the heart of the business district, near the main shopping district, the home of the Montreal Canadians, and several restaurants within a few blocks..just bundle up,if it's cold ! I didn't go to any of the hotel bars or restaraunts, but they looked nice...See ya next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Needs a Reno”
Reviews.Author: Hibiscus99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights recently and loved the location, but found the decor really dated and a little worn. We attended a conference in the lower level and again, found it dated and really dimly lit. The rooms were clean, and roomy with large windows, but the walls are thin, so you hear a lot in the halls. The bar makes an awesome club sandwich and Thai chicken soup - highly recommended. All-in-all a totally average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: madridvoyageur
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 3 night on a business trip and the experience was overall very good. A big and pretty standard hotel confotable and well maintained. The bow-window in the room gave it some "charm" (don't expect a boutique hotel though). The bed was confortable. Staff friendly and helpful. Very good breakfast (I found it a bit exprensive though - 25$ - but I must say I don't know how it compares to Montreal standards) and good-quality room service food. Free wifi Internet connection. Out of the 3 nights I stayed there, they forgot to leave shampoo in my bathroom twice!! This is only a small detail, but I must it is an upsetting one where you have to get out of the shower to make a call and ask shampoo (they came immediately though). Location is convenient: there is a subway station accessible directly from the hotel that takes you almost anywhere. Then, this is downtown, not the best place for a stroll. For a holiday, I would go to Vieux Montreal or to the Plateau area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: FEN_10
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! It was probably the best hotel for the dollar we've stayed in for quite awhile. It has a metro (subway) station right there - two stops away from Old Montreal; a great little muffin/bagel place for breakfast (or a Starbucks also); we were two (city) blocks from Rue St. Catherine and the entire underground city shopping mecca. Onsite parking made things easy as well. The room was great, the view was cool, and we swam in the pool and enjoyed the whirlpool each night - all in all, tough to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a fantastic price”
Reviews.Author: EAC13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly placed in the center of Montreal, close to the highway. The lobby is very nice, the wood panels gives it a nice warm feeling. The room was clean, modern and the bed very comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. We had the buffet breakfast in the restaurant. It was abundant, tasty and great selection. A very good deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Deb4545
Reviews.Content: This Marriott was adequate. The room was nice, and it was clean. However, we had to wait in line far too long to check in because the hotel had only one clerk on duty. The atmosphere of the bar/restaurant was nice, but the alcohol selection was very, very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Ricksreview
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in downtown Montreal which is well maintained to Marriott standards. It is an older property with allot of rooms. It is convenient to shopping and dining albeit a little far from Old Montreal. That is just a few train stops away or a long walk on a nice day so it is really not a big problem. If you like to go out at night then Crescent Street is a few blocks away and it is always hopping on a weekend night with its bars, restaurants and clubs. This is overall a good property and a nice place to stay if visiting the wonderful city of Montreal. You can enjoy Montreal in the winter with its underground or get out in the summer when the people enjoy the outdoors and warm temperatures they have been waiting for all winter. Learn a little french to be able to be polite and use a cab and you will be warmly received. Being able to greet someone in French and ask them how they are in French goes a long way in this city. Be respectful and the respect will be returned to you. Most people in Montreal speak English but a proper greeting in French will be a friendly gesture that should be when visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station , Bell Centre, shopping”
Reviews.Author: Gerard B
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel for events at the Bell Centre. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No Issue ! Just what I expected from Marriott !”
Reviews.Author: montyofkanata
Reviews.Content: Well located in downtown Montreal Quebec. Perfect, Absolutly nothing to complain about !

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Visit”
Reviews.Author: HNLGAL
Reviews.Content: I had to stop over in Montreal unexpectedly on New Year's Eve and was tired and had no desire to 'party' or be around others who were 'partying' and made my wishes clear at check in. I was given an (upgraded they said) room on the 30th floor with a superb view and a lovely layout (loved the huge oval window overlooking the city!). I ordered Room Service (very nice) and settled down for a nice quiet evening. However there was one nagging problem. The heat would not go down lower than 23C (almost 80F)! I called maintenace four times, and he did everything he could including opening all the little windows in the room (and it was cold out!) but it was all for naught. That heater just worked harder! The last time I called him at 4:45am and just asked him to bring up a fan as I couldn't take it any longer. Not once was another room offered, which I found mystifying. Suffice it to say, I was in the gorgeous hotel and had a rotten, rotten night. The next day I called the Front Desk Manager and explained what had happened and after she asked if I had been offered another room and my saying no, offered to give me the room at 1/2 price. It helped I admit, but it didn't help my exhaustion the next day, which was yet another travel day. Disappointed to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelling_cannuck
Reviews.Content: Good place to rest when travelling. Within close proximity of all major locations in downtown MontrÃ©al.

Reviews.Title: “Going to the Bell Centre for an event? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ESK1M0
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our short stay at the Marriott Chateau Champlain. The room: We stayed in a renovated room on the 25th floor. It was clean, well-sized and had fantastic west-facing views. The room had a contemporary yet homey feel with yellow and rich orange tones. The two queen beds made the room seem smaller, but it was what you would find at other hotels. One feature this room had that not many other hotels have is a separate dressing area with a closet, mini-fridge, safe and full-length mirror. The staff/service: All the staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and professional. Check-in was quick and effortless. The five elevator cars meant that we didn't wait long to get to and from the room. The doorman -- who is the first person you meet upon arrival -- was a friendly, helpful and professional older man who made sure our welcome to Montreal was warm. The location: This hotel is centrally located. The purpose of our visit was to go to a hockey game at the Bell Centre. This hotel is a two minute walk from door-to-door of the Bell Centre. It is also a few blocks away from Ste-Catherine Street, Crescent Street and most of the nightlife in the area. Overall, this is a great deal of a hotel in a central location. It's perfect for those who are from out of town and are going to events at the Bell Centre.

Reviews.Title: “good location , renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: mohnaz
Reviews.Content: way above the marriott standars I would say . exterior : Older hotel, has charm . Rooms : renovated and rather spacious rooms , bathroom was on the smaller side nevertheless clean and new . free wifi for a day and then you had ro re-register . walking distance to St. Cathrine and entertainment district , connected to subway . staff were courteous and responsive . the ons I encountered with were all English speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charl3s
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my short stay in this nice hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was nicely decorated and the internet worked fine. The location next to the chapel and a food mall was great. So was the view from my window. Also, the gym is well equipped to get fit in the early hours. I will definitely come back here when I have business in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Recently remodeled - recently disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dreaming*of*a*beach
Reviews.Content: This recently remodeled hotel will not have to worry if I will return even with a great corporate rate. I had issues with my door not locking and management seemed minimally concerned. On the upside, this is a large hotel that has a wonderfully decorated lobby. I was not impressed. I'll be at the Hilton next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, great refurbished rooms”
Reviews.Author: arnos.grove
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of years ago and agreed with many reviews - a decent hotel with good staff but looking just a little tired and chintzy. However, on arrival the very friendly receptionist offered a refurbished room on the 22nd floor and tremendous it was too. Any chintziness had been well and truly banished leaving a large smart room, with some cracking views. That said, the view from my colleague's room (2202) was stunning - straight up the street to Mont Royal. And in the very cold weather it was a treat to have direct access to the metro network. Only downside a rather cramped bathroom but this was more than made up for by the spacious room, which had a stack of storage space as well. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: Just spent an evening at this hotel and it is very nice. I have read the reviews about the hotel being dated, but the room was nicely updated. We stayed on the 29th floor with very nice views of the surrounding area. As a platinum member we recived 1/2 carafe of wine and a cheese plate, along with breakfast vouchers for two. Overall, the beds are new and comofortable, TV & bathroom redone, what you would expect for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sweetjuly0723
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending New Year's in Montreal and we stayed at this Marriott for 2 nights. And the accomodations were great. We stayed on the 29th floor, although facing the back, we still got a glimpse of the city. The room was spacious, clean and had a king size bed. the hotel had a starbucks which helped to pick up some coffee, tea or hot chocolate because it was quite cold. The hotel is centrally located as we took in a cirque de soleil show on fri nite and it was walking distancee to the hotel. So despite the frigid temps we walked it due to the proximity rather than taking a taxi. For new years, we went salsa dancing at a place called salsatechque which was also walking distance, which was great and the temps felt a bit better on new years eve. Definitely recommend the hotel...friendly and bilingual staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luisa B
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Chateau Champlain was a good hotel and pretty centrally located. It sits on top of the train station stop, so that is pretty convenient if when it's cold! The room was clean and spacious, served our purposes well, as I like to spend most of my time getting to know the City and not the room. I would definitely stay there again if I had another opportunity to visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: bvcbv
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for 3 nights for visiting purposes. The hotel is in the center of Montreal. Also it has direct access to the underground city (very nice in winter times). The old city, downtown, shopping area and bars area are really within walking distance (we did not have a car and never missed it). The service was great as well. The rooms are well equipped and good in size. No complains except for the price of breakfast â€“ about 25 CAD per person (but there are tens of restaurants in the underground city within 5 min walk so we eat there each morning). I will stay here again if I will be in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pk k
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, like others have noted, central location. 15 minute walk at most to most attractions(old Montreal, the modern art musuem etc). It is attached to the metro so very easy to get to from the airport and to get to other places in town. The streets around it are busy, but hotel itself inside was quite and great view (ask for a higher floor, I was on the 26th). Staff was very nice. It was also quite clean, even though it is getting a little old. It is well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveler22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for few days during a business trip. I had the choice of choosing a different hotel, but I was interested in staying somewhere with easy access to the subway....and I got a treat!. The hotel has a elevator that takes guest to the Bonaventure subway station....literally, one doesn't need to go outdoors. The hotel is connected to the underground city, where one finds everything we need. The rooms was well appointed, clean. The bathroom though was a little small but I was okay with it. I asked for a renovated room, they gave me one on the 31 floor.....with amazing city views....super nice. I highly recommmed this hotel. I will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: 69gtojim
Reviews.Content: This is a great Marriott Hotel with a perfect location being attached to the Metro and Underground. Would stay here again anytime

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little old, but still a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: charlsp
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night recently as we were in town to visit some universities. Paid $169 for the night. We had a room on the 27th floor facing north. The view of Montreal and Mont Royal was great. Also, the hotel seems to be very quiet. Even though the streets around the hotel are fairly busy, the rooms are quiet. The hotel is getting a bit dated as it still seems to have a 1970s type of look. The bathrooms will need to be renovated soon. But the room was clean. Parking underground is a bit pricey. I think it was about $20 for 24 hours. Access to the Montreal Metro is great. The Metro stop is right underneath the hotel, no need to go outside, and you can get anywhere downtown fairly quickly. There is a Starbucks in the hotel downstairs, That's where we got our breakfast on Sunday. They need more employees at the Starbucks. There were only two people working and the line was quite long. When I said I wanted 4 oat-meals to go, the woman did not look happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel convenient to the train station”
Reviews.Author: longtimeresident
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our one night stay at the Marriott Chateau Champlain. We are Gold Members and because it did not have a Club Lounge, they gave us complementary breakfast buffet for two. We were shocked at the gorgeous view from our high floor overlooking the skyline of Montreal and the nearby parks. The room was very new, modern and clean. We were very happy with the size and view. The hotel is easy walking distance to St. Catherine Street, where all the bars, restaurants and shops are located. It is also two blocks from the train station where we boarded a train to Ottawa the next morning. We also enjoy running and it's less than a mile to enjoy a nice run along the St. Lawrence in the heart of Old Montreal. Whether you need a quick stopover or a nice hotel to stay at while in Montreal, The Marriott Chateau Champlain is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “a disappointed Platinum customer.”
Reviews.Author: mwadams
Reviews.Content: 1. bathrooms so small that you have to close the door to move across to the tub. distance from door to toilet seat is about 2.5 inches. 2. room temp wouldn't go below 74... lost many hours of sleep because i couldn't get the room to cool down enough to be comfortable... the hotel had to move me to another room where i experienced the same problem and required maintenance man to visit my room while i was away. 3. the room they moved me to on the 32 floor was directly under a construction zone... so if you like your wake-up call to be hammering, heavy objects being dropped on the floor, then please request this floor.... the hotel made no mention of any construction zones when i booked the room or when i was checked in. when i called at 6:48am to complain, the front desk supervisor told me they had no control over it. 4. the night of my arrival, after traveling for 15 hours. the bar waitress decided it was better to argue with me over whether or not i was asked if i wanted the large glass of wine or the small glass of wine ( large glass of house red was $16.00). 5.Housekeeping doesn't know what the privacy door tags mean apparently and they will bang on your door anyway to deliver some chocolate and what ever else they do for the turn down service... very annoying when you don't wish to be disturbed and you are busy on a conference call. Over all, as a 3 year platinum member (also diamond with hilton), i travel a lot and my impression of this property was given a fair chance as i have stayed here for almost 5 weeks now over the last 2 months... only because of the corp rate of 139.... i would never pay what they charge the regular customers for a stay at this property. i was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Spot to Stay As Always”
Reviews.Author: wellthisisit
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I just spent the November 11th weekend here. Needless to say, the service was spectacular. My friend had broken her ankle and was in need of a wheelchair. The hotel not only supplied us a wheelchair for the weekend but also allowed us to take it out so we could go shopping and have dinner etc., I thought that was a nice touch. It absolutely helped in insuring we had a great time regardless of our situation. We had a room on the 22nd floor which was very clean and cozy. It was nice being able to just relax with a cocktail and our chairs facing the wonderful view of Montreal. Anybody booking this Hotel will be very pleased I am sure. I know that any time I go to Montreal we will be staying here without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, wonderful service, in a wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: yup_1976
Reviews.Content: This is located right near the Bell centre, Old Montreal, casino's, museums, you name it, it is close by. Very easy to get there. Their parking garage is low, so if you ave an SUV, you need to park down the road a little bit and across the street. The lounge is very inviting. Great aps, food and great drink menu. The city is very safe and clean. We stayed during the hocky playoffs between the Bruins and the Canadiens and when their team lost, the locals demolished the city. Every business we were in that day warned us to be in our hotel by 8 PM because it was going to get roudy. Even though there was a lot of chaos, we did not feel unsafe one bit. Great people, great city, great Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with Starbucks in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: hardern
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. The front desk staff were great. They were close to capacity so upgraded me to the concierge floor. I can't comment on the concierge lounge because I was too busy working. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. They said that the room was recently upgraded, but I think the rest of rest of the hotel is still being worked on as some parts seem a bit dated. They really should change their cleaning solutions. It smelled like a urinal in places - not good. The lounge was understaffed for the evening of a conference. Myself and my colleagues left after about 15 minutes of being unattended. The restaurant was tasty though.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be...”
Reviews.Author: Bozzie63
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel after about 10 years since the last stay. I must admit some aspects of the hotel have gone down hill. Primarily some of the exterior walls, steps, various areas need a sprucing up. There is also a strong deodorant/cleaning solution smell in the main lobby that didn't go away. I'm not sure if that's due to the maintenance and such but I don't recall such a strong smell. Otherwise, the pillows were big and not as cushy as say the Westin. Rooms are on the small size but that's probably a function of the hotel design. Nice large panoramic windows help. The TV service stinks. No real HD and limited regular channels. All things considered there are far more appealing hotels in Montreal at the Marriott price point, e.g. Loew's Vogue.

Reviews.Title: “Good windows!”
Reviews.Author: Voyageur_americain
Reviews.Content: They call this place the cheese grater ("rÃ¢pe Ã  fromage") because it looks like a giant white box grater. Nice big semi-circular windows. Rooms are somewhat dated. Bed was VERY comfortable with lots of good pillows. Bathroom modern, good lighting. Hallways dated. Same problem here I've had with other Canadian hotels: the service ethos is just not where it should be. I was offered a choice of newspapers; none was ever delivered. I mentioned this on the way out and was told, "Oh, they forgot to tick off the box on your record." Elsewhere, there would have been a better response. Doormen were helpful. I could never get the room temperature higher than 19.6 degrees C. There must have been some trick to it. Location is great, right above a Metro stop and an easy walk to shopping, Sherbrooke Street, and Old Montreal. Nice to have the Starbucks in the lobby but it closes at 3 on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at an old-fashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: fitubolla
Reviews.Content: You can tell that the Chateau Champlain used to be a mega-luxury hotel, but is now getting older. This was not a bad thing though, I think. The decor in the lobby is old-fashioned but glamorous, yet the hotel room was fresh and up-to date. Internet worked fine (although you have to re-activate it every day, silly system), beds and pillows were fine, toilet/bathroom were nice. The room was clean and of ok size (very large for a European, normal size for an American). Breakfast is not included, but for 21CAD (plus taxes) you get a very nice buffe-style breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. Highly recommended if you are starting a day of heavy touristing. Hotel is centrally located, metro station is downstairs. The 747 bus going straight to the airport stops just two blocks away, much cheaper than taking a taxi. I stayed at the hotel as part of a work trip, so I can not say if the room price is great or not. It is not the cheapest hotel around, but if you get a price quote you can accept, I think you'd be happy at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable bed great French Onion Soup, "Lite" free wifi”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel2345
Reviews.Content: If they doormen are welcoming and helpful then I know the customer service will be good. The doormen rarely greeted us, one almost ran me over carrying bags out and we often called for our own bags. There was one in particular that was very helpful all the time and he made up for the others shortcomings. The concierge service was excellent. These ladies were fabulous, spent as much time as you needed to make spot on dinner reservations. The restaurant was comfortable with cozy traditional and luxurious decor. The french soup was to die for! The best thing about this hotel are the beds. THE most comfortable beds and dark shades we had to haul our selves out to get the day started. The value was very good and the location was close enough in walking distance the old Montreal and St catherine street (midway between both). If you don't speak french no problem the staff was bilingual and moved easily between english and french. They changed USD to CAD at the desk. DO not waste your money on the concierge lounge. It was tiny filled and with small tables and the food had very small quantity and options. there was also no free booze. To call it a lounge was a joke as there weren't any large lounge chairs anywhere. They did NOT have free wifi in the lounge and the free wifi in the hotel was a "Lite" version so you couldn't download big files or stream videos.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Z
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Montreal and I had a blast. Check in was smooth and very helpful. The hotel was beautiful and I had an excellent view of the park. Its location is very convenient in the sense that it was close to the convention center that my trade show was held in as well as the underground. The restaurant was WONDERFUL. It was the best meal that I had in Montreal which was very suprising.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly best hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: dssrriri
Reviews.Content: Smooth check in, 30 th floor room with a super view of downtown. Decent exercise room, though limited by size. Starbucks coffee shop in lobby area, small but nice elite access lounge. Rooms were like other marriotts, the exception being modern bathrooms. Overall for the price, a decent hotel in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Classic Montreal”
Reviews.Author: exda85
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located in downtown Montreal, a city which i am sure will be one of the favored destinations for 2012. Shopping streets, city squares even the old town is nearby within a 10-20 minute walk. the hotel is an old refurbished property and that's the only complaint and it will not satisfy those looking for cutting edge modernity. The staff is attentive and I must add the room service not only fast and not expensive for some of the best hotel food I have encountered. Try the lamb chops or (sea) scallops appetizers..magnifique.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but difficultl front desk”
Reviews.Author: jyoung3381
Reviews.Content: On saturday July 2 at 9:00 AM, I arrived at the Marriott from a cruise ship for a two night stay. There were two young ladies at the front desk. One of them told me that they were sold out and my room was not ready for check-in. They told me to call back to the hotel in an hour. (first issue is why could they not call me?) I sat in the lobby area and watched my ship mates arrive and check-in without a problem. At 10 am I checked back at the front desk and was told they had an empty room and it was being prepared and to check back in another hour. I sat for another hour and watched each arrivee check-in to their rooms and take their luggage up the elevator. An hour later I went to the front desk and encountered a young lady who I had not seen before ( Ema I believe) and asked her if my room was ready yet and she said.."We do not have to give you a room until 3:30" I promptly left her and went to the "tall" young lady who I had talked with earlier and she said my room makeup was on "expidite" but could not tell me when it would be ready. I then told her I have watched each person arrive and promptly check-in, why couldn't I? She could see that I was upset and then offerred me a different room that was immediately available. I understand that I failed to call the Hotel in advance and ask for an early check-in. I guess I am writing this compalint because I was not offerred a different room that was obviously available earlier and the disresp that Ema showed toward me. I asked for the General Managers name and address and sent Mr Jacque Hamou an E-mail which was not responded to, then a followup letter, again no response.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here when we visit Montreal”
Reviews.Author: LoveParkLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always stay at this hotel, not only because the location is excellent (Metro station entrance is right in the hotel, and the hotel is within walking distance to just about everything in the city), but also because they treat us so well. We've probably spent about 15 days there over the past year or so. This last time we visited, in early September 2011, we stayed on the 24th floor in a room that faced Place du Canada and had a beautiful view of downtown. They are very accommodating and the concierge has helped us with directions, maps, and reservations. My only complaint is that the restaurant has little to offer vegetarians and/or vegans, but there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance, so that really isn't a problem. The bed is very comfortable, we have no problem with our Internet connection there (as we have had at other hotels in various cities in Canada), and the bath amenities are very nice. Until we finally buy a place of our own in Montreal, this is where we will continue to stay!

Reviews.Title: “It's the windows”
Reviews.Author: KKSStLouis
Reviews.Content: This was a standard Marriott--very clean, well-appointed rooms, comfortable beds, friendly staff. What really distinguishes this hotel from other higher end chain hotels in the immediate area (the Queen Elizabeth, Delta, Hilton, to name a few) are the views and more specifically, the windows. The hotel is a high rise (about 36 stories), so the higher floors have great views. However, the windows are half moon shaped, with the rounded edge up, and go from floor to ceiling. They are also curved outward (from above, imagine a rectangular room, with one of the short sides of the rectangle "bulging" out) As a result, you can walk into the center of window and see not only the view in front of you, but a fair amount to the sides as well. We had 15th floor room facing north, towards Mont Royal. The view was spectacular, especially at night, and sitting or standing in the window made us feel as though we were suspended above the city. On the more practical side, the hotel is an older one and the room, while in great condition, wasn't particularly large and the bathroom and hallway leading to it was a bit cramped. Also, there was no room safe and the mini-bar was, as usual, outrageously priced. Still, I've stayed in most of the neighboring hotels mentioned above over the years, and the level of service is about the same. The tiebreaker here is definitely the views--none of the other hotels come close

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blueangel1961
Reviews.Content: Just spent two wonderful days at this hotel. When you book ask for a room on a high floor (we were on the 23rd floor) overlooking the Place Du Canada. The view was simply amazing; especially at night. In addition, the hotel is nicely located within walking distance of dozens of restaurants and bars. Moreover, a subway station is located below the hotel that you access through a special elevator in the lobby. Old montreal is simply 4 subway stops away. Also located at the lobby level is the Montreal underground, without realizing you actually walk out of the hotel into the shared underground city. You'll find two inexpensive breakfast choices within 100 feet of the lobby. The hotel also has a Starbucks location there. Enjoy this hotel and this truly world class city. Forgot to mention the nice indoor pool and exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better full service Marriott's I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: bienemy
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Montreal before and staying at this hotel only increased my positive impression of the city. It was extremely close to the Bell Center and Old Montreal was just a short walk away. The rooms were well done and very comfortable. I thought these rooms were a touch other full service Marriott hotels I had been to. The concierge lounge was really nice and had a good breakfast. The bellhop was very helpful when I went looking for some restaurants. There's not much else to say. I would definitely stay at again for business or personal travel in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location- Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arlington7175
Reviews.Content: I reinforce much of what has already been stated. We are loyal to the Marriott, which is why we selected this hotel. It is not the perfect location for tourists, but it is good. The hotel is not in the old,historic part of the city, but it is walkable within .5+ mile. It is very well located to downtown and as other reviewers have stated it is connected to the subway system. Also, you can walk from the underground city to the Marriott without going outside. It is a little awkward but it is connected via the Bonaventure metro station. The concierge lounge is not as nice as some of the other Marriotts, but this is a minor issue. We werent crazy about the exterior architecture and looks a little dated on the outside, but our room was completely updated and well apportioned. The rooms are slightly smaller than many other average Marriotts, but it is comfortable. Finally, if on a higher floor, the views are very nice and likely quieter from street noise. Staff are very friendly and personable. All things considered, we would return to this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLB6061
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Rooms renovated with several amenities in the building, including a direct underground link to the subway. Decent location - haflway between the shopping / dining at St. Catherines and Crescent, as well as Old Montreal. 15 min walk from each area.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: hoteltraveler40
Reviews.Content: Pros: Property is located next to a subway station. (The station can be accessed without leaving the building.) Beds are comfortable. Rooms are quiet. I did not hear street noise. Only occasionally did I ear noise from hallways or other rooms. Very helpful concierge staff. Cons: We stayed during the summer heat wave. Room never got cool. Windows are curved. Curtains go in a straight line from one end of the curved window to the other. Heating/cooling vents are located behind the curtain. Your nighttime choice is to keep curtains open, allowing cool air in the room, but also the distraction of city lights, or close the curtains and roast. Cost of parking is excessive. If breakfast is not included in your rate, turn right at the gift shop in the lobby, continue into the attached office building. There you will find a restaurant (Le Muffin Plus) and a stand either of which will provide a nice breakfast for approximately $5.00 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown location near everything”
Reviews.Author: patch4750
Reviews.Content: At the end of a train trip from Quebec, we needed a place close to the Gare Centrale for an overnight say and this Marriott lived up to our expectations. We had a room that had recently been renovated and there was a minor amount of builders dust around. Nothing that a good inspection woulnt fix, but everything else was in perfect working order.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JB88fml
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Chateau Champlain several times over the years. In fact, twice in the last two months. Most of the rooms have been renovated to the new Marriott standard. They are quite nice, similar to Marriottâ€™s around the globe. Flat panel TV, free wireless internet, full hotel services are all there. The rooms have a massive half moon window with spectacular views of the city (ask for a high floor). The Marriott beds and bedding are always the best and the rooms are quiet. It is in a good location in the center of Montreal and only a couple of blocks from St. Catherine. Parking will add $28 to you nightly bill, you may save a few bucks on this elsewhere but you will not have in/out privileges so unless the car is staying put I would advise you to take the parking. The dining options in the hotel are expensive and not advisable. You are in the center of the action so take advantage of the great restaurants all around you. The hotel also has a pool and fitness center. The employees are all very friendly and helpful. I will always return when I can get a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Central to downtown and old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ottawacarol
Reviews.Content: We arrived without a reservation, but were treated very well at the front desk and given a room with a wonderful view. The hotel is about a 5 - 10 minute walk to downtown and a 15 minute walk to the old Montreal and the waterfront. We found the hotel to be extremely clean with large rooms and the beds were extraordinarily comfortable. We never heard any noise from the hall or other rooms. Upon check-in we were given two coupons for each of us to have a free drink in the bar which was a nice touch. Bathrooms were quite nice with a sort of a dressing area attached. We parked a couple of blocks away at the AutoPark on Stanley - an indoor garage - and felt our vehicle was secure. It was only $14 for 24 hours. We only ate breakfast at the hotel and found it rather pricey. With so many restaurants around it really is worth it to leave the hotel to eat. We bought our wine at a convenience store a couple of blocks away, but the wine/liquor store is only a couple more blocks. The fitness room is one of the best I've ever seen! The pool was fine, but be warned there is no shallow end. Still they have lots of pool noodles and other types of floatation devices. There is also a hot tub. While the rooms do not have balconies we were on the side that faces the water so we had a great view. The mini bar was amazingly well stocked. We found the staff to be really courteous.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: adila9119
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb. Efficient and friendly service. Fast check-in/check-out. My only problem is for a hotel with high rating as this the furniture in the rooms is not up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation system needs an overhaul”
Reviews.Author: recklessfriend
Reviews.Content: We entered hotel from the parking garage to a beautiful hallway with high ceilings and chandeliers and gorgeous architecture and I THOUGHT we had made a great choice. It was a downhill slide from there. First off, admittedly through no fault of the hotel we were given a hard time at check in because we forgot our Government ID at home. Once that was sorted we were told we had a room with only 1 bed. The Marriott online reservation system allows you to book "one king or 2 doubles" and then asks you to check off your preference further into the reservation process, the same place you would ask for things like pillow preference or extra towels or early check in or higher floors. AT NO TIME DOES IT SAY YOU WILL NOT BE GIVEN THE ROOM TYPE YOU ASKED FOR. Apparently THIS Marriott makes the decision randomly as to where in the hotel you go and what room type you get. I have never encountered this problem at the other Marriott hotels that I have stayed at. The girl at the desk sent us a cot, a cot that looked like it was thrown out behind a homeless shelter. It was caved in, the mattress was stained and the frame itself was rusted and dirty. When we called down to complain and insist on being given the room type we booked we were told they were full and nothing could be done. I asked for the supervisor who called me back a few minutes later (I am pretty sure it was just the employee standing next to her). The "supervisor" was incredibly rude and again told me there were NO rooms available in the hotel and that she would send me a different cot or I could try going to another hotel down the street!!!! She said that they encounter this problem with the reservation system all the time and were not the first to complain and certainly not the last. I suggested they give us a second room with 1 bed and she said there was no way this would happen and we would have to accept the room we were given. She also pointed out that they had 5 floors under renovation and that SHE did US a favor by putting us on a higher floor in a non renovated room. HUH? She then said she would have a supervisor call us (thought we were already talking to a supervisor). The next call was from the Food and Beverage Manager??!??!? Although very friendly what does he have to do with room reservations? I work in a hotel, our food and beverage managers wouldn't even know how to turn on the desk computers let alone make or move a reservation. He feigned surprise at the fact that the hotel was so busy and offered my party free breakfast and wanted to come and look at the cot. He also offered to cover our parking charges. So basically we slept with 3 people in 1 bed and the 4th person on a cot (cot was replaced by a marginally better one). A very annoying and disappointing start to our night away. When things go like this then you tend to notice other things like the air vents full of cobwebs, the crumbs on the old carpet, the shower curtains that leaked and left an inch of water on the floor, the lack of additional towels we requested and the general rudeness of most of the staff. I generally enjoy the Marriotts that I stay at but DEFINITELY would never go back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: sheilaoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the Metro line and in the heart of the downtown area. Very helpful staff and as a Marriott Reward Gold member we had free internet, breakfast, and concierge lounge availability. Bar is rather small but nice. Menu was quite nice and not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Turndog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business. Good location for business district. I concur with some of the other reviewers that the property feels "dated". I was charged $235 for a king on the concierge level (not clear that it's any different than other floors). The room was somewhat on the small side and was dowdy. The TV looked to be 20 years old (no flat screen). The bathroom needed updating. The front desk was very pleasant. I expect I could have found a better option at that price level.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: chrishockey55
Reviews.Content: Rooms where perfect bellhop was extreAmly nice he went out of his way to tell us where to eat ... It was a great recommendation very good location but no access to mall expect for the metro. Rooms where renovated and perfect but I really wanted to rent a movie but it was down on the tv the room came with pizza and drinks and a free movie beause they didnt have the movies working they accomadated us well I recommend this hotel as much as I recommend the amazing bellhop whos name I forgot and most off julie at the front desk for makeing my stay amazing.. I would reccomend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Best room service food ever!"”
Reviews.Author: llc-mycroft
Reviews.Content: One of my daughters and I stayed at the Marriott for two nights in early August. The hotel is in a terrific location, a short walk to the main shopping area, business district, McGill Univ. and Mount Royal Park, and only a slightly longer walk to Old Montreal, where we spent an afternoon windowshopping and watching street performers. The concierge at the Marriott offered great dining suggestions, with a view toward good food + entertaining atmosphere for my daughter. Our hotel room was lovely. But what really dazzled us was how wonderful the room service breakfasts were -- elegant, beautifully prepared, and filling enough that we cruised through lunch, saving ourselves for dinners at the restaurants recommended by the concierge. One travel tip: you can catch the express bus to the airport half a block from the hotel -- it's $8 per person (must have coins, not paper bills), a fraction of the $38 flat rate cab fare to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: Lochs
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Montreal by train, from Toronto, which was a lovely relaxed 5 hour journey. Beats the plane any day!. We were able to walk to Chateau Champlain which is only about 150 yards from the station. We requested a high floor room which we got. Looking out over the front entrance of the hotel the view was wonderful, looking right across to Mont Royal. The room was excellent and we enjoyed just sitting at the window with a glass of wine, watching the world go by. There is access to the Metro system from the hotel, but if there are two of you it is just as cheap to take a taxi into Old Montreal. We felt we needed the taxi as it was a bit too far to walk - well in nigh on 100deg heat it was! Place Jacques Cartier is where most of the restaurants are, although do branch off some of the side streets and you will find lots more. We did a 2 hr walking tour of Montreal with an excellent guide. The tour included entering the Basilica, which is beautiful. Montreal's history goes back about 300 years but there is not a lot to see of great interest on the walk. ( We are probably spoiled coming from Scotland where 5th century is considered old, not 1700's). We also did the Amphi tour; which was supposed to last 1.5 hours but we were back in 55 minutes. When the vehicle goes into the water the noise is shattering and the commentary difficult to hear and not especially great. A lot of money for what you get! If you are going to travel by train this might be useful to know. From Toronto to Montreal you can check in your luggage and get reserved seats. From Montreal to Quebec you can do neither. You carry your cases on and it's first come first served for seats. The lines form up very early, so the sooner you are in line the more likely of getting seats together. The snacks available on board the refreshment trolley are good value and fresh. The staff on the trains were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Was okay”
Reviews.Author: solstice21
Reviews.Content: First of all: Everyone who worked here was extremely nice and helpful, and the location was good. Comfortably removed from the intense nightlife, but close to everything we needed. The decor felt a little dated, and the ambiance was a bit dull. Room cleanliness wasn't ideal (found a pair of bright pink underwear in the bathroom). Also disappointed that the "free wireless internet" was actually "free wireless internet for 24 hours ." I'd stay again if there wasn't anyplace else available. But I wouldn't go out of my way to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “So happy with our hotel choice!”
Reviews.Author: Barb826
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was recently renovated and look great! Everything is new, clean and very comfortable. The room was rather large with a nice desk for computer work and they offer free WiFi. We were on the 19th Floor and the rooms had very big windows to help you enjoy the great views of the city. The location was perfect too! It's an easy walk to the main attractions in the city and better yet...the Metro stop is under the hotel! We parked our own car in a nice parking garage across the street. I believe it was around $20-$25 per day. Valet parking is also available for slightly more. We weren't using our car during our stay...so we didn't see the value in spending extra money for the valet option. There is a bar on the main floor of the hotel and a Starbucks! We were very happy with this hotel choice and I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “It'll do”
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 4 nights when we discovered that he could not use his Marriott points to book a room at the Springfield Suites by Marriott in Old Montreal. The rooms were rather dated and the bathrooms in particular could use an upgrade. However, we weren't expecting luxury. We wanted to explore the city and the location of this Marriott--near downtown, on top of Metro, and about a 20 minute walk to Old Montreal--provided us a good home base. We were upgraded to the concierge's level but didn't check out the lounge as it was closed on weekends, and we received free breakfast but also skipped that to check out the local fare.

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Here...There has to be better hotels across the street”
Reviews.Author: Clinton S
Reviews.Content: It's an older hotel that has a older feel, little tired but not too bad. Our experience with the valet service and bell men was inexcusable. When we arrived the bell man acted as though we did not exist. I did not arrive in a small, old, beast up Kia. Had a new full sized Hertz rental...and why should it matter. So we carried in our bags and checked in. This older gentleman asked if I wanted to valet my vehicle after checking in. After waiting and being ignored initially, I decided to boycott the valet service. I decided to park it in the building...it's a maze underground. Wen I returned...I let the valet take the vehicle. Later in the evening I called and asked how long for my vehicle to be brought up. They told me just a few minutes...more like 20. The following morning after breakfast they asked if I wanted my bags brought down, and I said yes. 30 minutes later I went for them myself. When I complained to the manager she asked us to send her an e-mail and offered 15,000 Marriott points. Room dated and tired. Hotel dated and a little tired. Breakfast buffet was much nicer than most offered today and the staff was pleasant. I would not waste my money at this hotel. If I want mediocre service and dated rooms there are so many others to choose from. WHY STAY HERE?? BTW...Location is not close to the old district.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Older Hotel-Superior Location”
Reviews.Author: azracegirl99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Chateau Champlain (locally known as the "cheese shredder" because of the architecture) from July 12-16 2011. We were given this hotel as a successful bid for a 4 star hotel on Priceline. Great location. Newly renovated rooms feature Danish modern furniture, kingsize bed, nice linens and GORGEOUS views. Excellent location that is walking distance to St. Catherines St., the underground city and the subway. Rubens Deli is two blocks away and open from early morning to late evening. Great inexpensive homemade food and huge splitable portions. We ate most of our meals at Rubens.

Reviews.Title: “Viva la Differance!”
Reviews.Author: SGMCanada
Reviews.Content: Montreal is a wonderful city to visit. There is not a problem not speaking French in the city as most people go out of there way to help you. The hotel is older now but is still lovely and you are well treated and cared for by one and all. The views from the hotel rooms are amazing. My 31st floor, city view, took my breathe away. The only probelm with the hotel rooms is the cleaning staff start at about 7:00am and no matter where your room you will hear the doors banging shut. The reason is the elevators are in the centre core of the building -- both for guests and for cleaning staff. The Metro is directly under the hotel which is a great help. Park the car, use the Metro and enjoy Montreal without the hassles of driving. The Botanical Garden's are beautiful. They close for some unknown reason at 6:00 pm in the summer. That does not make sense but go early and enjoy a lovely day. It is easy to take the Metro down to Old Montreal for dinner and walk around and enjoy live outdoor entertainment. There are many choices for excellent meals and you don't have to break the bank to enjoy the evening out. My meal consisted of salad, main course and dessert for $16.95. The Jean Talon Market is worth the Metro ride and a fun place to spend some time. Many produce are Quebec made which is nice and adds to the fun of wandering through this market. Have a hunger for smoked meat sandwiches? Two of the best places in the city are Swhartz's and Lester's. Swhartz is the better known and the busier of the two. Lester's is on Bernad off St. Laurent. You can eat out on their front walk patio and oh how good the food is! Go...enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory, but could use some 'zing'!”
Reviews.Author: markw_bd
Reviews.Content: The Chateau Champlain is well located in Downtown Montreal. It's close to the shopping and to the Old Town, both are walkable if a little tiring on a warm day. It's a modern(ish) hotel overlooking Canada Place - tip try and book a room on the upper floors with a view over Canada Place. The public areas are beginning to look a little dated and could use some 'lightning and brightening'. They really should do something about the check in desks as the staff seem to peer over them as if from a bunker - so it makes it feel slightly unwelcoming. That said the reception staff were friendly and helpful. I also found the hazard tape stretched rather unattractively across the revolving door at the main entrance made one feel one was entering a murder scene or building in the process of demolition. I'm sure it was there for a good reason, but you did feel that the first impression it gave was more one that the management couldn't care less. The room (King size bed) I stayed in was fine, comfortable and clean, although the lack of a safe deposit box in a supposedly upmarket hotel suggests it was all put together some time ago. The bathrooms are best described as 'compact' or 'bijoux', and could definitely do with a bit of updating. There's plenty of closet and draw space so no complaints on this front. My room had a TV, but the channels are nothing to write home about. I'm sure Canadian TV has a lot to offer, but strange not to find BBC World or CNN as one of the options. Great views if you get the right room. I used the gym and it was OK, again looked like the equipment had seen plenty of use. There was a pool, although can't say anything about it as I didn't use it. I tried the hotel restaurant breakfast one morning. It was nothing special, and you're probably better off eating out, or going to one of the concessions that is co-located in the hotel. The biggest positive about the hotel is the bar. Nice, friendly, helpful staff. Good tapas menu not too expensive, but the wine was overly priced in my opinion. Good approach to internet connection. Free, although you could upgrade to faster packages. I found the speed for the free service was perfectly acceptable, although I'm guessing if you want movies or Skype you'll need to upgrade. But I applaud the fact they provide a free service. I tried but failed to use the business centre. If you are Mac based, unless you have a USB key to copy documents to which then need to be loaded to the business centre PCs you'll struggle. There is no way of printing directly from a Mac. And it works out very expensive as there is a minimum charge which makes printing a single page about CAD$3.50. I never saw it attended, so help is minimal. All in all perfectly acceptable, but not somewhere I'd rush back to.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: djfan88
Reviews.Content: We took the train to Montreal for a quick weekend getaway. The Marriott is very convenient to the station, there's an elevator in the hotel that takes you directly to the Metro (which was straight forward, quick and easy to use). Our 28th floor room was nicely decorated with a good city view but felt a bit small. Concierge was helpful with info on local attractions and provided Biodome combo tickets for $39.99 each. Not sure if this was much of a discount, but saved some time waiting in line. Had room service one night, very quick delivery and tasty food. Breakfast at the on-site restaurant was good, not great. Had to wait quite awhile and it was quite expensive. The restaurant seemed a bit stuffy compared to the lovely breakfast we had at a restaurant in Old Town. Lovely fresh food, surpisingly reasonable prices and so much nicer to sit in the shade on the patio enjoying the view. All hotel staff we encountered were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “great service! great location! will definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: anastacia06
Reviews.Content: SO pleased with this hotel! The staff is amazing, and so helpful. We arrived pretty early and had requested a high floor room, which was not ready...but they checked us into a room and helped us move our belongings the next day! It might sound like a hassle, BUT it was totally worth it--and we got there before check in time. The view from our second room was AMAZING! We were on the 27th floor...and could see everything. The rooms were both very different. I think the higher floors were just renovated. The best things about the hotel were the following: it was CLEAN! the concierge (we were able to see such GREAT summer events because they told us about them--fireworks! restaurants!); Patrice (one of the staff members --he told us about all the hidden gems of the city--restaurants, sites to see, where to walk); the metro! is right under the hotel!! Bonaventure. Definitely made traveling around the city so convenient. There is also a a few restaurants in the hotel--cheap eats, a lounge, and a more pricey restaurant. We ended up getting coffee and a bagel almost every morning--so good! The gym, spa, and pool area were all really clean! My mother ended up swimming every morning--she loved it. Also it is in the PERFECT location! It is a five minute walk from the Bell Centre, <10 min walk to St. Catherines (where all the great shopping is), <20 min walk to Old Montreal...For the first three days of the trip, my mother and I walked practically the whole city---it was great! BUT if you don't like walking...metro! The internet is not free here...just for the first day. We ended up spending the 40 dollars for 3 days of internet...probably the only downside of the hotel. They also do money exchange at the hotel--100US at one time. Definitely kept us in check for our spendings...hehee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: madreRochester
Reviews.Content: We came to Montreal to celebrate our 30th anniversary. The staff at the Marriott Chateau Champlain were charming, helpful and truly made us feel special. They even sent us a bottle of champagne to celebrate with. Our room was spotless and comfortable. The linens and pillows were so heavenly!. We had spa treatments while we were here - the ladies that gave us our exfoliation and massages ( Florence and Violette) were excellent at what they do. My only complaint is that the spa is the walk through for the gym and the pool and you can hear every sound while people walk through talking and slamming doors. I understand that there will soon be remodeling done that will take care of this and it is much needed. The pool was a comfortable temperature. The hot tub is old and small but clean and felt great after a day of walking around Montreal. The rooms offer fabulous views of Montreal through enormous picture windows! We would definitely return to the Marriott and are so pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samcker
Reviews.Content: We came to Montreal for the Josh Groban concert at the Bell Center. I think it was only 2 blocks away so great location. We were even walking distance to Old Montreal and St. Catherine Street. The pool was nice a little chilly for me, but the rest of my family loved it. We ate dinner in the bar area the first night. Good food. The rooms were pretty spacious. We stayed in the standard double. Beds were so comfortable and I like that there were extra pillows on the bed. Bathrooms looked very new. My favorite thing was there was a Starbuck located right inside the lobby area. It closes early, but very convenient in the morning. Definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “"Can't wait to go back"”
Reviews.Author: Nicole155008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite large and when we were there very busy. However, once you get in your room everything is quiet and peaceful. We could hear nothing from the other guests, the sleep quality was excellent and the bedding very nice. The room has a minibar and all of the usual comforts. As well as a comfy chair to read in and a nice desk and chair. We spent a lot of time working in the room and it was a well set up place. Free high speed LITE internet. Breakfast is not included, there is a very nice restaurant downstairs, breakfast buffet is $21 plus tax each. Expensive, but it was a very nice buffet, the only thing missing was a coffee selection.

Reviews.Title: “45 of us stayed here as a group and it was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: abbycody
Reviews.Content: Never been to Montreal before so I was nervous booking a hotel in the city for our big group. The Marriott downtown was perfect! We got a great deal on our room and all rooms had a magnificent view of the city or the river! Although it wasn't in Old Montreal, I enjoyed the 20 minute walk there at night and back to eat dinner and be a tourist. Some people who didn't like to walk took a 5 minute subway ride down there. It was easy access to the subway which we took every day to our event...a direct elevator from the train went straight to the lobby! I think the best part of this hotel was the service and people...from the moment they greeted you at the front door to take your luggage to any little request we had, they waited on us hand and foot.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, inconvenient, rude, generally unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: honeybadger77
Reviews.Content: Very unpleasant and inconvenient stay. Front desk look like they do you a favor when they provide you a service, they don't go out of their way for you even if you are a silver member, generally you get a feeling that you are not welcome and you are interrupting their business. I had to stay in the hotel for 9 nights, there was one night unavailable in the middle of my stay, and the staff did not even try to accommodate me, didn't put me on the wait list, they just said it is unavailable and there is nothing they can do. I moved out after 2 nights and went to a different hotel, which made my business trip, which was already tough, much more difficult. You get charged for EVERYTHING - even the internet in the business center! And print-outs / copying / scanning in the business center. And even if you are ready to pay, you can't always do it - copying costs money, and you have to have coins, because the credit card reader does not work. Internet in the room costs a fortune. Room service food was extremely expensive and mediocre to say the least, and it looks like I was overcharged on the final bill, but I will be confirming it today (yet another inconvenience). Very clean though, and a great night sleep. I will not stay in this hotel again if I have a choice, and it confirmed my general unhappiness with the Marriott brand.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved - but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: SavorSluthTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is going through the Marriott PIP finally. Unfortunately, they had to modernize an outdated space. Did a decent job with new tvs; beds; furniture; and bathroom fixtures. However, nails on the floor in the bathroom; old closet structure; weak concierge lounge and service (valet is atrocious) continue to bring the hotel to just an average property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, elegant lobby, helpful and professional staff! 4+”
Reviews.Author: marqoos_pl
Reviews.Content: Marriott Chateau Champlain is really nice place to stay when in Montreal. Centrally located, close to town attractions and connected with subway system (very handy elevator from the lobby). Valet car parking available, but quite expensive and sometimes we needed to wait a little bit longer. Check-in was absolute pleasure - quick, efficient and hassle-free. Room allocated on the 27th floor as requested. Lobby is really elegant and my favourite - fresh flowers compositions were on display. Room size was all right, spacious enough for 2 people staying. I was quite surprised with decor, I expected something more modern, but that was still nice to stay and be in. Two comfortable Queen Beds provided really good quality sleep. Be sure that you have your bathroom door closed during the night, as bathroom could be bit noisy (you can hear wind flying in the ventilation pipes). I loved wall-size windows and great views (day or night-time). Bathroom was clean and fresh. I liked large mirror and toiletries provided. Reception staff and concierge were always helpful and could answer my questions or assist with some suggestions. Well done. I'm sure next time visiting Montreal that would be first place to check rates. Hotel is maybe not the newest, but for sure comfortable and conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1tiredpuppy
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed here July 5-10 on my points & had a great stay. The staff was very nice & answered all of our questions or helped us with any issues quickly. They didn't blink an eye when I requested a late check out. The room it's self was very well done. The double beds were so comfortable you didn't want tot get out of bed, but one look out the very large windows & were drawn to the city. There is a separate chaning area by the bath that was very handy when one of us had to be up very early for meetings. You don't wake the other person up. We used the gym every day and really enjoyed the equipment with their individual TV's (bring your earphones). Due to my status with Marriott, we had access to the lounge. The breakfast was top notch. We only were there for one evening meal, bit was very god also. This hotel is within walking distance to everything & if you need to take the Metro, the station is accessed from the lobby. You can't get any closer then that.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with fantastic views and great location close to bus routes, main shopping streets and parks”
Reviews.Author: Georgiew14
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with fantastic views and great location. Comfortable bed and rooms, friendly front office staff who remembered room type and likes from previous stay week prior. Doorman didn't help with luggage which was disappointing in the snow, but great place.

Reviews.Title: “First class place in good location”
Reviews.Author: glboh
Reviews.Content: My wife was in Montreal for business, and I went along for the trip because I love the city. We would have stayed in a cheaper place except that her employer paid for the hotel. We enjoyed it very much. Parking was very expensive, although not by big city standards. It cost us $120 for 6 days. We never used our car, but we needed it because our trip included other destinations. The restaurants were expensive, too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Jazz Fest & Old City!”
Reviews.Author: UnconditionalPeople
