Reviews.Content: Stayed during Canada Day and the Jazz Festival. This was a great location for access to everything we wanted to do. Concierge was very helpful, planning tours, providing suggested running routes and restaurant suggestions. Good choice for a family vacation. Blogged about our stay here: http://www.unconditionalpeople.com

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SylvieFrancois444
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with my hubby the July 1st weekend. Chateau Champlain is a wonderful place to stay! We were very well located on the 33rd floor with a view of the Old Port and the St.Lawrence River. Loved the windows! Very well located in the centre of Montreal. Two minute walk to the Bell Centre. Would definitly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Central location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: midatlantictraveler1
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel while visiting the city and were impressed. The room could use some updating, but the prime draw to this hotel is the location. I can't imagine a better place to stay when checking out a hockey game, or visiting the city by Metro. The hotel has its own entrance (and elevator) to the Bonaventure metro station. From here you can go to most any site in the city without a car. The curved windows in the hotel are unique, something I have never seen anywhere else. We probably did not get the best room in the property, as we arrived on an early morning flight. We were allowed to check in WELL before the check-in time, and got a front-view (north, Mont-Royal facing) room. We saw in the hotel photos that some rooms had been more renovated than ours, so it might be worth it to you to ask for one! We were so overjoyed to get a room at 9:30 AM that we were not complaining in the least. The staff was very accommodating, 100% bilingual, and helpful. The pool/fitness room facility is nice, and well worth a visit. My only negatives for this hotel are that they charge for the extras (with the exception of Internet access, which is free). The business center appears to be a business venture which charges outrageous fees for any printouts except airline boarding passes. Room service and restaurants are overpriced, and you can find better in the local community. Yelp is your friend. Don't use the hotel to change USD/CAD... but they will gladly make change so you can use the soda machines. If you use Bank of America you can go to ScotiaBank in a 10 minute walk and use totally fee-free ATM's with a far better exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “Chateau Champlain - the funny windows hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLHoz
Reviews.Content: The Chateau Champlain, now a Marriott, is centrally located in the interesting part of Montreal. Two blocks from the main railroad station - "Le Gare Centrale" underneath the Queen Elizabeth Hotel - two blocks from St. Catherine and just several blocks from Cresent St. - the street of the famous restaurants and nightlife. Great rooms, flat screen TVs, desk and new-style task chair and an easy chair. They don't have in-room safes but they do have 24-hour access to safe deposit boxes (yes, boxes like banks). There is a smallish pool, a spa and a pretty decent free 24-hour fitness center for a hotel. The hotel has it's own elevator access to the Metro (subway system) at Bonaventure and is only one block from the Bell Center (Bell Centre) and easy indoor access to Place Du Canada. There is also a nice bar and restaurant on the 1st floor with a convenience store and a Starbucks. The staff is extremely friendly and courteous, multi-lingual and knowledgable (with the exception of one female Concierge with glasses - but maybe she just didn't like me). There is a 24 hour bus (747 Express) from the airport to Rene-Laveque Boul. and downtown that makes several stops and is close to many hotel locations in Montreal for only $8.00 Cdn. A taxi ride will cost you $35 - 40 Cdn. easily and they charge for additional passengers. One such 747 bus stop is only a block away from the Chateau, Sheraton Center, QE and Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!! Very elegant and superb service”
Reviews.Author: imoreno
Reviews.Content: The concierge, special lounge concierge) upstairs was spectacular. from the accommodation to the service and employee attentions and pampering was just what I expected and Marriott here is doing great job when it comes to making you feel pampered and taken care off.

Reviews.Title: “US Marriott's should follow suit!”
Reviews.Author: dba80
Reviews.Content: A great city center Marriott, positioned in a great location in Montreal. Refined common areas, guest rooms. Good food and polished service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: stella61
Reviews.Content: Room and bed were very comfortable. Nice showers, great water pressure! Convenient location. Metro station access below hotel, could hop around the town easily. Quick walk up Rue Peel to shopping, restaurants and clubs of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience. I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: rgpieper
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of downtown Montreal, this hotel is very nice with a very accomodating staff. Jose is the Libation Dispenser at the Bar & Restaurant and he makes it a relaxing and enjoyable time. Try the Penne Rigate at the bar with a Blanche de Chambly Biere. A very good wheat beer! Jose can suggest a very good wine if you prefer!

Reviews.Title: “Four stars for the renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidinMontreal
Reviews.Content: Have stayed many times at the Marriott Chateau Champlain but this is the first stay in a renovated room. The orange-brown colour scheme is visually relaxing. Wing chair for reading is by the window and a pleather ergonomic chair for working at the desk. The king bed was heavenly thanks to the plush pillows, the downy comforter, and the firm yet soft mattress. I wanted to sink into the bed and never get up. The renovated bathroom features more improvements, starting with the large square mirror lighted on all sides, quite effective and eliminating the need for a close-up mirror. New sink, faucet and Kohler toilet. But the best feeling is turning on the shower and feeling the amazing water pressure massage your tired muscles. The only thing missing is a tower ring or bar to hang the damp towels. There is only the short hook on the back of the door, but thatâ€™s inadequate for two people to hang the hand, face and bath towels. Donâ€™t know how this was overlooked in the redesign. The front desk service is good or bad, depending on who serves you. The bellman and porter services are good. Iâ€™ve given this hotel 3 stars in the past, but now itâ€™s up to 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “I'll certainly be back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: haaagh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to this nice hotel for vacation. Despite of my booking which was done through 3rd party company in the lowest possible price, we have got a king room in 21st floor which I guess was renovated recently. The room had a great view to downtown Montreal. The service at this hotel was great and you have access to metro station from inside the hotel. There are several tourist attractions in neighborhood. Although this hotel is in downtown Montreal, but it is located beside a cozy and calm park, so you wont hear the downtown noises. The staffs were friendly and tried their best to find a solution for guest's concerns. Thanks Marriott Chateau Champlain

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice views, nice location"”
Reviews.Author: SciGirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to get via taxi and the airport bus (which was a fraction of the taxi ride). The rooms are good sized, service was quite good, though the hotel has groups staying on weekends, and the tour group for one night was very rowdy. The front desk forgot to give me keys to the mini-bar which is just as well so I didn't break into it to satisfy midnight munchies. The free wi-fi is a big bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: petewanner
Reviews.Content: At checkin i was offered a room with 2 doubles in a renovated room or a king in an older section - never, ever turn down the option of a renovated room. I took the king bed in the old section - broken furniture, leaky plumbing, peeling wallpaper, air that struggles. Very comfortable bed so a great sleep and this hotel is downtown within walking distance of hundreds of eateries and tons of shopping - and all in lovely Montreal. - but so is the Sheraton Centre where I would have gone in retrospect

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Kavits_MJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in July 2007 (sorry the date is wrong as I cannot select anything further back. I stayed here after spending a week in the mountains of Quebec at a Yoga Ashram so it was great having a huge kingsize bed and room to myself. The beds are comfortable and to Marriott standards. The rooms are a loittle noisy as I could hear next door singing in the shower which was very amuzing! The staff were fine, no one went out of their way to be friendly. I just wanted to lay down and rest, the room service was good and a good night sleep was exactly what I needed before my long trip to Vancouver the next day. The hotel is ideally located close to the shopping area which is great.

Reviews.Title: “30th floor for the view of Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: mossalop
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Marriot in Montreal for 4 nights at the end of April. Got the hotel at a reasonable rate so I think my opinions are swayed by that factor also. We had a room on the 30th floor at the front of the hotel so we had an amazing view of the city. Really made the room feel even larger than it was. Massive bed provided a disturb free sleep. Location of the hotel made it perfect for sightseeing and getting to know Montreal. With a Metro stop directly underneath the hotel, its dead easy to get around the city and back to the hotel afterwards. Its not exactly a cheap place but you pay for quality.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at a high end hotel”
Reviews.Author: amhOttawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight with my teenage daughter as previous plans fell apart. Easy switch on the website from 2 nights to one and a king bed to 2 doubles. The hotel is classy, with an updated 70s feel. The room was clean and roomy. The bathroom and dressing area take up considerable space but are separate from the sleeping area (really nice with a teenager). Window overlooking downtown was gorgeous. We are Marriott Gold. The lounge was closed but breakfast buffet coupons were cheerfully provided. Breakfast was very good. Wifi good and free. Parking $20 without in/out privledges. Everything needed was walking distances so upgrade to valet with in/out not needed. Overall, hotel was impressively comfortable. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great rate!”
Reviews.Author: Dutchgab
Reviews.Content: Get a front facing room near the top and have a great view. Within walking distance of most things you might want to see. Perfect for weekend. Not a quaint cozy hotel but was great for a big hotel. We were able to get it for 143 a night when we called directly. Not sure why it was so much cheaper doing it that way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodel”
Reviews.Author: flyboycanada
Reviews.Content: For the past 35+ years that I have stayed at this hotel, service at the Chateau Champlain has always been excellent. We decided to use our Marriott points to pay for our two-day stay. We were delighted to be given a newly renovated room with new wallpaper, paint, carpet, bathroom fixtures, furniture and decor (including the fresh paid smell). Finally gone is the big tv enclosure. The only negative change is the table by the window was replaced by a smaller one suitable only to solo travelers. The room has a much better feel, the mattress is very comfortable and the room appears more spacious. Good job Chateau Champlain.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, very comfortable Stay"”
Reviews.Author: Boeing_737_800
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal on a business trip and stayed at Marriott Chateau Champlain for a week. I asked for a front view room and got one (you may need to let them know of this in advance). It was a very comfortable room with fast internet connection. The bed was comfortable, washrooms very clean and modern. Food / Breakfast is expensive. One can eat in the building nearby "1000" - it has all eat outs like Subway, Pizza etc and not expensive. It has its own loyalty program, but people with Star Alliance or other airlines may want to add miles to their existing program.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel; needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I found this hotel at half price, and for this money it was a good deal. The hotel, while "classic" in the sense that it coud use some renovation, was actually very comfortable and pleasant. The room was very large and easy to work in, with a nice king-size bed. Location was excellent -- connected to a Metro station, it was one block away from the Bell Centre (go Habs!) and within walking distance of some excellent restaurants. The best was the hotel bar, with Eric P tending; super-nice guy who poured some nice drinks for us. If you can get a good rate, you'll be very happy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - but hotel is old and the staff was rude”
Reviews.Author: soccergirl123
Reviews.Content: The location is great, but the rooms at this hotel were very dated. The carpet was worn and the furnishings were old. Made you seem like you steped back in time. The location is good as it is close to shopping and the middle of Montreal. The staff was not very helpful. For example when I checked in at night. I asked if there was valet parking and he said you look young... you can self park the car. Then when I asked the front desk for help on where to shop, they were not very helpful and told me to go outside in frigid winter weather and ask the bell captain. I was very surprised as this is suppose to be an upscale hotel... or maybe it once was an upscale hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, needs a bit of updating to charge what they do”
Reviews.Author: newtraveller68
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel in February. I was there on business and brought my husband along. The room was decently cleaned but on the small side and the decor is a bit outdated. The bathroom was tiny, you couldn't sit on the toilet and close the door or open it without it hitting your feet and knees. We ate in the concierge lounge for a light snack about 5:30 and the variety was pretty good. We also had breakfast there the next morning. They could have had a bit more variety, there was enough fruit but no Oatmeal (except instant) and no waffle machine. I had a boiled egg and fruit and those were quite fine. My husband had cereal and a muffin, which he reported as decent. The view from the room where we ate was terrific, and would be even more beautiful in the spring/summer. In the fall it is probably the most georgious since the foliage on the hill would be nice. We didn't use any of the other facilities but did look around and they appeared nice. The location was fantastic as we were able to walk anywhere we needed to go. Although the weather was freezing so walking was not pleasant. That's not the fault of the hotel though. I did expect the room to be nicer for over $200 a night. The bed was comfortable enough but the room was very small and they had an awkard vaniety area outside the bathroom. The wall paper was quite dated and the carpet was worn in areas. Not a bad place to stay but for the money it wasn't worth it. If they lowered the price by $50 it would be totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, traditional charms”
Reviews.Author: Hotelguru2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with colleagues for 1 evening and I have to say that I was thoroughly impressed. The rooms were large and immaculate. The bed was enormous! The staff were all very polite and helpful. Bathroom was clean and the toiletries were all good quality We all received a free beer token upon checking in which is a nice touch. I am planning on heading back there in a fortnight when I return to Montreal with work.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at this Marriott”
Reviews.Author: vivace21
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend with my husband in Montreal, and I am so glad he picked this Marriott. He often says at the Chateau Champlain when in Montreal for business, and and I can see why it was his choice hotel. The lobby/entry is very elegant and has classic old style hotel decor. There are several shops to explore in the lobby area, including Mont Blanc (lovely jewelry selections), plus a Starbucks, a clothing store, and your typical newspaper/drinks/candy store.I enjoyed strolling around and checking out all the things available in the lobby. Also we ate dinner at the restaurant located in the hotel and the service was outstanding. Our waiter couldn't have been friendlier and the food was great. Additionally, we had the breakfast buffett and it was so outstanding we had to come back again the next morning. Now, the rooms were on the small side, I will say that was somewhat disapointing, but what really made up for it was the huge curved windows. It was lovely to look out over the city. Request a high floor and a city view. Bedding was comfortable, room was clean. Bathroom had nice marble accents but was small. I had trouble adjusting the water pressure on the shower. But at least there was always plenty of hot water if you could figure out the adjustments.Oh, another thing, they were skimpy on towels. So ask for extra and they will oblige. As many have stated, the location is perfect, and you can go right under the hotel to the metro station or enter the underground shopping area, and on a cold February day in Canada, that was a much appreciated feature. Overall service was outstanding. The staff really impressed me. Check out/in was easy and quick. I am looking forward to staying at the Chateau Champlain next time I am visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: molly273
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and beautiful. One can access the underground mall and subway without going outside. It has a nice restaurant and bar, too. Beautiful, luxurious, yet very reasonably priced...we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “My go to hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: jo28352
Reviews.Content: Central location. Clean. Typical Marriott. The one area that excels is the restaurant/bar staff, who are above and beyond. Over the past few years, it seems the rooms are becoming in need of renovation. I trust they will do so before things get too worn and the hotel loses its charm.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: globalbiztravler
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing room. Everything about it is old, dingy, out of date and generally disappointing. Ancient and small television. Tiny wood desk is chipped. Chairs are extremely uncomfortable. Bed is mediocre. Bathroom area has a cramped layout and is dark and uncomfortable. Even the thermostat is old dials and nobs from the 1970's. Had to fight to get a king size bed I had requested because they claim entire floors are unavailable due to renovation. Of course there is no mention of hotel being under renovation when you make your reservation through Marriott. Skip this place. Not worth the money at all. Much better places to stay in Montreal for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Option”
Reviews.Author: leonardomrc
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay! The room was very clean! The bed was very confortable! Great view of the Mont-Royal and the city. The hotel has directly access to Bonaventure subway station and to the underground city. Good and free wireless signal. Only two blocks from the malls 1 block to Centre Bell, right above the rail station! Highly recommended! A good choice is to make the reservation directly on the Tourism Montreal website. They will give you great discounts on the room rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, great room, great service”
Reviews.Author: DuffManOooooohYeaaaa
Reviews.Content: Room had a great view and great quality for the price we paid. Very clean, friendly staff, great location. Also staff were very patient and never hesitated to go above and beyond the call of duty. Great stay, I would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone :)

Reviews.Title: “Should have been better”
Reviews.Author: JoeMary01
Reviews.Content: Stayed in late November. Hotel conveniently located with connections to Gare Centrale and Metro as well as underground city. Staff fluent in English-French. Room was on the small side. Nice view. Furnishings on the older side but OK. Ate at bar Le Senateur. OK but on the expensive side. Starbucks in lobby as well as a coffee place and a breakfast shop. Was OK first two days then hotel seemed overwhelmed by a large wedding party arriving (possibly two). Awakened a 3:30 A.M by loud knocking at door. Called desk said they would send someone up - when mentioned at desk in morning they said they could get the person who checked on the noise. Room otherwise quiet. Desk clerk seemed put out when I asked for an umbrella for myself and spouse (the ones they gave out were really ONE person umbrellas). Check out good via room TV. High spped internet was good and free. Limited TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Big-city Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travis_anderson
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed in many hotels--even big, multi-amenity hotels, that were run this smoothly and that had a staff as helpful as this one was during my stay. The hotel is huge (36 floors, with three floors of conference rooms, multiple shops and restaurant options), but the concierge desk was always staffed (often with several employees), the front desk employees were always helpful (and all were multilingual), and the services all ran smoothly. The hotel even had a self-service (and free) computer at the bellhop desk for printing boarding passes. Features: an upscale restaurant, and around the back, past several shops, were a small, deli counter and a diner-like cafeteria; a medium-sized, but elegant front lobby, with lots of seating spaces; great views through huge curved windows, clean and well-stocked rooms, comfortable beds, and a great central downtown location only blocks from the Eaton Center, train station, and hockey stadium; and the Bonaventure metro (subway) stop is accessible from inside the hotel, as is the underground city (the interconnected underground mall that runs throughout downtown). Another plus: the bus stop for the $7.00 airport express bus (route 747) is only a long block north of the hotel, between the two parks In short, you couldn't want a better location. Parking was $20 Canadian for self-park / $25 for valet. Wireless internet. No pets. Nice pool and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Cruising down the St. Lawrence”
Reviews.Author: Donnel
Reviews.Content: We found everything especially good at this hotel. It is a rather old hotel but is well-kept and handy to most everything. It is moderately priced for any one leaving Montral on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inefficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Neptune-salacia
Reviews.Content: This is a major hotel in downtown Montreal, so the location was great and the building is old and charming. However, Internet did not work in the room (signal was weak) & technicians could not fix it. They added the cost of a modem to the bill and it took me a while to convince them that I was never given a modem. Asked concierge for directions, but the old guy mumbled a few brief words and carried on his chatting with a friend. The spa area was so loud. I had a massage and people were chatting right outside the door with lots of kids running around. Will not stay there again if I am ever back in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “perect location”
Reviews.Author: salsa2522
Reviews.Content: This was a great location and a great City. We could walk to Old Montreal or take the metro if we wanted. Centrally located for all attractions in Montreal. The view from the room was beautiful and the Hotel itself, restaurant, lobby and bar were all excellent. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A better sleep than my own bed”
Reviews.Author: Ree29
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and would recommend it without hesitation. It is a short walk from the train station and St. Catherines and a short cab ride to the great shops, restaurants and nightlife of St. Laurent. The best part of the rooms is the beds. Superb linens made for a more comfortable sleep than in my own bed. Even had breakfast in bed from the room service and although it is a little pricey, the portion was very generous and the food was good; better than the buffet breakfast in the hotel's restaurant - Samuel de Champlain.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, but a bit dated.”
Reviews.Author: drewie79
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at this Marriott. In terms of location, it is perfect! Only a few blocks away from the busy shopping distrcit on Ste. Catherines, and the Orange line Metro running beneath the hotel. It very much met my needs! For accomdation wise, the building is old, but that doesn't necessairly mean its bad. I had a great king room high on the 31st floor. It was very comfortable, especially the bed, I love Marriott beds and the fluffy while duvet with crisp white sheets, it is truly very comfortable and makes you want to stay in bed all day! The furnishings however are a bit dated, such as the desk, chair, TV, carpet and wallpaper. I understand it being Montreal and wanting that "old-french european" feel, but I much rather the "burst of color" rugs and flatscreen TVs and such at other Marriotts. The staff are fantastic and very friendly. I would recommend this Marriott if you're looking for a central location, with everything within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Still charming place after all these years”
Reviews.Author: StarwoodBoo
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd visit to Marriott Chateau Champlain and it feels like revisiting an old friend. The hotel is warm to your needs with charming old style room that is comfortable. I didn't close the curtain at night because there's not much tall buildings in the immediate area, so I just woke up enjoying the sunrise. The lobby has a Starbucks and another cafe in a connecting building. Access to RESO is via an elevator to the metro station. The bathroom provides good quality accessories and the shower pressure was excellent. The bed was very comfortable and I slept with ease. I will return to this hotel definitely for the old style Montreal charming experience.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and refined”
Reviews.Author: roadwar1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, elegant hotel. Very friendly in the heart of the city. Walking distance to all. perfect location for those in twon to watch a hockey game

Reviews.Title: “Reviews not always believable!”
Reviews.Author: bento2744
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Reward member and looking for accommodation in Montreal and as I always, I read reviews on Tripadvisor, before making a reservation. There were enough negative reviews of this property, I was surprised and hesitant to book this property. But, the location was my primary reason for selecting this hotel and at the same time having confidence in standards Iâ€™ve experienced with Marriott properties. After our stay in Quebec City at Courtyard, we took a train to Montreal and the station was nearly under the hotel. We took the escalator up, out the front door of the station and the hotel was 5â€� away. We had luggage on wheels and had no difficulty walking to the hotel. The friendly checked us in quickly and to our room on the 21st floor facing the park in front. I think one of those negative reviews mentioned that the property looked old and in need of remodeling? I found none of that to be the case. It was very clean, well appointed and modern. Our room had a half moon shaped window with a trim, perhaps they meant that was old fashion? I spoke to one staff member and he indicated that some dÃ©cor left on purpose not to lose old World charm. Complain about the size of rooms was unfounded! I have traveled all over the World and I can tell you plenty of encounters with small rooms! In fact the rate for this property was less than Courtyard in Quebec City and room much larger. Transportation to the airport is fixed rate at $35 and cabs are available in front 24/7. Canada is a very beautiful country and we enjoyed our visit, but be warned that it is extremely expensive. I heard many Europeans complaining, especially the cost of dinning out. I would like to spend more time in this city and would not hesitate staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clara17
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel; this summer we went around couple of towns in Canada. This hotel was among the great hotels that we stayed in. Their staffs were friendly. Our room was extremely clean. We loved the location. We recommend it to our friends for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Cratch
Reviews.Content: Excellent river-view room. Comfy bed, excellent bathroom and good buffet breakfast. Great for a business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service. Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Loiners10
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 2 nights on my first trip to Montreal. Service from reception, valet parking and concierge was faultless. Nice bar and excellent choice in the restaurant at breakfast. Good gym/leisure facilities for a 4 star city centre hotel. Good location for exploring Montreal on foot. Not the most modern hotel room but provided everything i would expect from a 4 star and was clean. Can't comment on value for money as i didn't pay! I would stop at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired”
Reviews.Author: Travellinggirl2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby was very grand and promising, but unfortunately the room did not live up to expectations. I was on the 28th floor which had a great view, but the decor was very 90's and was disappointing. The room was fairly roomy just needing an update. The wireless internet was slower than a snail (although it was free), and the TV did not have many channels. The executive lounge was pretty good - the breakfast was very nice with juice, yogurt, toast, bagels, lots of fresh fruit, tea & coffee and the staff were very helpful. They also serve appetizers at 5pm and deserts at 7.30pm - and there was a good selection. You can self park for $20.00 per day or you can valet for $27.00 per day + tips, but the valet service is a little slow - on average 15-20 minutes wait time. I would use this hotel again for business purposes, because it is in a great location, right in the middle of everything, but if my trip was for leisure then I would choose something better like the Hotel Vogue.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: montrealcaper2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Chateau Champlain for 4-5 days during our annual family summer trip to Montreal since 2005. This visit was was as pleasing as every other year. From the pool to the staff, everything has been great. Every request to the front desk is positive. We generally arrive rather early(8:00 am), no problem. I request a room on a higher floor (24+) with Mt Royal view, no problem. We request late check out(3-4 pm), again no problem. Many references to $200.00 + rooms - over the last six summers my room's price range has been $117.00 to $147.00,(rates often change overnight, check out the hotel's website)during peek season and the Jazz festival. The rooms may be becoming a little tired, but they are super clean and very comfortable. I have stayed in other hotels in Montreal, but when you consider location, comfort and service - the Chateau Champlain is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average and bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: NZguy1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply not up to the standard of a first class downtown business hotel. The rooms are slightly shabby, like they need to be renovated, chipped sinks, scratched furniture, worn out facades on cabinetry. The floor I stayed on also smelled a bit musty. Room service was average...overcooked burger with no interesting presentation. A business center that you have to pay for the internet. It's just not what you expect for $200+ a night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay...memories that lasted a lifetime. Already planning to go back”
Reviews.Author: Summer346
Reviews.Content: In April of 2010 I stayed at the Chateau Champlain for three nights with my orchestra for a music competition. I didn't have high hopes for the hotel, but I was beyond surprised. When we first arrived, we had a room mistake (they only gave us a room with one bed) but we went down to the front desk and the staff were so nice and accommodating. They fixed the problem right away, and even offered to move all of our luggage to the next room. The rooms were very nice and spacious and we had a great stay. We had a wake up call every morning..and on the last morning when all four of us failed to answer the phone they even sent someone up to our room to personally wake us up. I have NO negative things to say about this hotel. I fell in love with Montreal, and I've already made plans to go back, and stay in this hotel again this time with my family. Great price, and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 2010CUBA
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel this year. Each time I have stayed 7 nights and have been very pleased with my stay. The location of the hotel is wonderful. It is close to everything from The Bell Centre, the movies, malls, shops, tons of bars, clubs and resturants. The metro is right underneath the hotel which is a plus. I found a lot of things I could just walk to...which is a money saver. There is a free shuttle to the casino everyday that runs five minutes past the hour and to come back from the casino it leaves 45mins past the hour. The shuttle stops at 7pm. My hotel room was very clean. The rooms aren`t the most modern but who really cares. When I am on a trip I dont usually spend a whole lot of time in the room. The beds are very comfortable and my floor was very quiet. Sometimes people just dwell on the smallest stuff and that ruins everything. The stuff were very friendly and helpfull! I noticed on other reviews for this hotel people were complaining about the price for this hotel. I always shop for my hotels on Hotwire and always find excellent deals. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Remember you will probably find something you dont like with any hotel. I cannot wait to return to this hotel in the very near future!

Reviews.Title: “OK but!”
Reviews.Author: stangina
Reviews.Content: Second stay here. Try and stay on the Cathedral side, where views are much better. Rooms are on the small side. Concierge lounge very good and friendly. As in other Marriott Hotels in Canada the Business Center and Internet are below par, but at least the internet is free for Elite members. Although this hotel is not at the top of the Marriott hotels, my colleagues spoke no better for the other hotels in the center of Montreal. Convenient to subway and underground shopping (direct connection form inside hotel) Valet parking was slow, recommend self-parking under hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired--needs some work.”
Reviews.Author: p169649
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times in the past. The room had a noce view on one of the upper floors, but there was a heat spell and the central air did not cool the room below 80 degrees. The linens were nice, but the bed was not the "Marriott bed" we have come to enjoy at other Marriot hotels we have stayed at. We never got a decent night's sleep. The decor was tired as well. Sorely needs an update. The breakfast room is dingy. The food was only average at breakfast. The best part of the hotel is that the subway is in the basement and the subway is an easy way to get to Old Montreal and the Plateau section. Highly recommend using the subway.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is like an older woman that is still very attractive but you can tell used to be really hot”
Reviews.Author: SOL_III_Design
Reviews.Content: Was in Montreal for the Jazz Festival. I booked my reservation thru Priceline so was not sure what to expect (if you don't know, with Priceline you only find out the hotel name after you pay and are locked in). Concerns were; Would it be too far away from the action? Would it be sub-standard (not 4 star)? I was pleasantly surprised to find this to be a fine hotel with everything one expects from a 4 star property. The staff was great. The room was very comfortable and the very clean and efficient Metro was accessible from the hotel basement! I usually seek out only boutique hotels when traveling but this was a budget minded trip and the Priceline rate made this an excellent value. As I alluded to in the title the Chateau Champlain was probably a top notch hotel two or three decades ago but it has aged well. I am a keen observer of all things design and architecture related and the unique design features of this hotel were a pleasant surprise. Montreal est tre magnifique! and the Chateau Champlain is good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatsDynasty
Reviews.Content: Great location...walk to St. Catherine's St. and within 2-3 blocks to 100s of restaurants. Next door to Bell Centre. Good Marriott Elite breakfast, snacks and deserts.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever. DO NOT choose this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cyyz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marriott Chateau Champlain for 2 nights. My experience was absolutely the worst. Stayed at a few 4-star hotels before, I can say this one is the worst I've experienced. The first night my room was next to a generator (as I was told by the person at the front desk), the perpetual humming noise made me awake the whole night. The tricky thing is you can't hear the noise when you walk/talk in the room. But the second you are in the bed you can hear it. I suspect the noise comes from the lower floor, so the vibration travels via the wall against the bed. As a result of it, I requested a room change. The horror continued. The new room was next to a service elevator. This elevator goes up and down more frequent more than you can imagine. When I requested the room, I specifically asked the person if the new one would be quiet. She said yes, and of course she lied to me with the knowledge that it's next to a service elevator. I doubt the fact that when they designed/built the hotel, they bothered to conduct an acoustic study of the rooms. This is NOT a 4-star hotel. There are many better hotels at the location. Do yourself a favour, choose another hotel chain. Having stayed at other 4-star hotels before, this one gives me the worst experience ever. If you do choose this hotel, make sure to avoid the rooms I mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Spotty”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_historian
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the CC in June 2010, and my wife joined me. As it happens, we had honeymooned there in 1971, so we were looking forward to a return visit. In 1971, the CC was pretty spiffy -- it was new, had a couple of highly rated restaurants, and felt modern and fashionable. That's all past, I'm afraid. The conference part of the hotel's service was quite good; continental breakfasts, a luncheon, refreshment breaks, and room arrangements were handled very efficiently and accurately. As for our stay, we got off to a bad start when no room was ready for us for our 3 p.m. check-in. We found this out only after waiting through a very long line -- the longer because the check-in worker ahead of us decided to go on break as we were waiting, and everyone in the line had to find other lines to join (at the rear). We returned to the lines twice more before we got our room key. Two of our three check-in people were exceptionally unfriendly, and the shift manager really looked like she wanted to be somewhere else. (This isn't characteristic of Marriott in my experience.) The last check-in person was much more personable, though not so very efficient. When we got to our room, the soaps from the previous guests hadn't been cleaned up, and no new soaps had been provided. We phoned about that, and, to give the hotel credit, two soaps arrived lickety-split. Other reviewers have noted the tired appearance outside and inside, which is true, and they note that the hotel connects to the metro and underground city, which is also true. If you arrive by train, the hotel is very convenient, and it's just a few minutes' walk to the touristy restaurants on Peel. But it's a fair hike from the more interesting parts of Montreal, like the old city, St. Catharine & University, the Latin Quarter, McGill, Mount Royal, and St-Denis / Prince Arthur. So it feels a bit out of the way. The most reliable part: the elevators. We never had to wait more than a few seconds, and they move fast.

Reviews.Title: “An Effortless Visit...”
Reviews.Author: sitcom
Reviews.Content: Yes the decorating is tired but not to be confused with rooms that are spotlessly clean and nicely sized. The staff is superb & helpful, the location is great for almost everything. We used the Metro and VIA Rail (to go to Quebec City) both connected to the hotel. Also shopped at the Underground on the day that it rained...it too is connected to the hotel. A 15-20 minute stroll to Old Montreal. Lots of elevators so little waiting, the concierge lounge is great and taxis are plentiful (although we used them only for airport transport and one local trip...they are expensive...use the Metro...its easy to learn, clean & safe and very fast to everywhere).

Reviews.Title: “A classic”
Reviews.Author: Iceair614
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just prior to the Grand prix weekend, and enjoyed the stay. Had no problems with the room, but as other reviewers have stated, it could use a refresh...but the room I was in wasn't too bad off and I found the bed very comfortable...wish I could have used it more. The downstairs bar was hopping when we were there and we ate there a couple of times with no complaints. Good food and excellent service. I was on a high floor, but didn't experience any annoying noises. We used the valet to park the car, which cost about $30 CAD/day. There is self parking, but it was just a couple of dollars less. The concierge lounge was busy in the morning's and twice we had to wait for a seat. Overall a good stay and if I get back to Montreal, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good stay -- location makes up for rooms”
Reviews.Author: cdn_vygr
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline for USD$105 + taxes. Frankly, I've never paid that much for a 4* hotel in Montreal before, and I feel like I've gotten better value for my money elsewhere (Hyatt Regency & Delta Centre-Ville, for example, both under USD$80/night). However, it seemed to be a busy time in Montreal and hotel rooms were in short supply, which might explain the higher nightly cost. At any rate -- the good points: The location of the hotel is excellent -- a short walk from the train station (where I arrived) and the hotel is right on top of the Bonaventure Metro station, directly accessible from an elevator in the hotel lobby. It was very easy to walk to Ste-Catherine street and Old Montreal. The lobby is classic and features a Starbucks (although its opening hours seemed rather short). Front desk and room service staff were excellent. A big plus was free wireless Internet, in room and in the lobby. I did order room service once, and the food was excellent. The bed, too, was excellent, as was the view, but.... The not-so-good points: The rooms. Others have said it here and it is true, the rooms are in need of a major refresh. My room was a king on a high floor, and it looked exactly as represented in the king room pictures the hotel provides on its website. The room was clean, but tired, and the furniture is slightly damaged and not particularly new. The bigger problem was the first room they gave me -- on the 33rd floor -- had a very noticeable humming/buzz that permeated the whole room -- seemed to be in the walls. In fact, you could hear it on the floor in general. I asked for another room and was given another one on the same floor -- but with the same buzz, although quieter this time. Eventually I got used to it, but it was somewhat annoying all the same. I actually got off the elevator at other floors to see if the buzz was there, and it wasn't -- so you may want to avoid the 33rd floor -- and maybe the floors around it. All in all, while the rooms were a bit outdated, the stay was pleasant and the location and service can't be beat. Had I paid rack rate for the room, I think I would not have been happy. Even $105 I thought was pushing it, but I have seen rooms at this hotel go for $80-90/night, which would be more in line with what it offers. A real refresh of the rooms would make a big difference. Two tips for getting around: (1) If you are arriving by train, you can walk underground to this hotel, by following the signs to Bonaventure Metro station -- be warned though, there are plenty of luggage unfriendly stairs and revolving doors on the way. If the weather is nice, I suggest walking on the street -- it is a block away. (2) Montreal transit (STM) now offers a weekly pass, from Monday-Sunday, in addition to its tourist passes (1 and 3 days). Passes now use an electronic chip card, which you have to pay for (up to $7.00, depending when you buy) in addition to the pass cost. Current prices are available on the STM website--but either way, the passes are a great deal since the subway gets you most places in Montreal so you can avoid high cab fees. And a final tip if you are a business traveler -- the business centre at the hotel is very expensive ($0.50/page for b&w printing!). There is a Staples/Business Depot/Bureau en gros at the central train station with an excellent copy-and-print centre -- use them instead. I needed to print a number of reports which I took to them on a memory key and they produced them in 20 minutes at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage hotel - that's good, and bad”
Reviews.Author: travelingFelix
Reviews.Content: The Chateau Champlain was built in 1966 and was one of the top hotels in Montreal. Location is great, close to downtown and walking distance (20 mins) to old Montreal. The hotel retains a lot of its charms, probably a little too much. Our room had a great view, was clean, and had nice amenities. The decor was tired, it lacked a safe, and the bathroom is 100% original as far as I can tell. Service is uneven - the staff is friendly and helpful, but the valet car parking is incredibly slow (call for your car at least 30 mins in advance), the maids are good, but the doormen seem to be mostly there to collect tips, not move bags. This hotel is a good value at $150 or under, but higher than that and you may feel you are not getting your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good food, outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: linlab
Reviews.Content: I travelled there for a conference taking place at the hotel. The hotel is connected to the city underground so this is convenient if you want to take the metro or go shopping. The rooms are nice but nothing fancy; the beds are comfortable. The look of the hotel and rooms is really outdated. The conference had buffet breakfast, lunch and dinner served in the hotel restaurant and a few sit down meals served in the ballroom. The buffet food was fine: basic choices (1 meat, 1 fish, 1 pasta, vegetables cooked perfectly and potatoes or rice), small but excellent salad bar (always fresh and varied with cheese & clod cut meats) and desserts too die for (and Iâ€™m not a dessert person!). The sit down dinners were excellent, very tasty and served hot and good size plates. I did not use the gym, pool, bar so cannot comment. Overall, the staff was nice, helpful and polite and it was a nice stay. I would recommend this hotel but I am sure that for the same price, you can get a nicer room in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, good locations, REALLY oudated rooms!”
Reviews.Author: OlyFoodie
Reviews.Content: We were really disappointed in the rooms. The old wooden vanity in the bathroom had numerous coats of peeling paint, the countertops and moulding were yellowing, the carpet was fraying and the a/c made a buzzing sound and was hopelessy inadequate against the afternoon sun and humidity. The beds are nice, but that is the only redeeming part of the room. I do have to say that one bellman (Patrice) gave excellent directions and restaurant advice on more than one occasion. He was very helpful and very knowledgeable about the restaurant scene.

Reviews.Title: “The worst checkout experience”
Reviews.Author: Quiquine
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Mariott Chateau Champlain for a business trip. Free late checkout is until 2pm. I asked if I could keep the room until 4pm to freshen up before flying back to Europe but they told me they would charge an extra night despite the hotel was almost empty and despite the amount of my bill was pretty high... Additionally, on the last morning the guy who checks the minibar insisted to get into my room while I was still in pajamas to lock the minibar, just in case, I found it so gross ! Besides I did not like to have to walk in a corridor of the underground city (at the subway exit) to go get breakfast at the restaurant, this was a little bit stressful in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location to the Bell Centre and Place Bonevanture Montreal”
Reviews.Author: sbdotraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an extremely friendly staff, they made us feel welcom from check-in, conceirge, the bar staff and check-out. The rooms are well decorated but my only gripe is that the bathrooms are a little outdated. The shower water controls were not precise. We could not get the water temperature to stay, onem second it was hot then cold then scorching hot. The bed was very comfortable. This hotel has direct access to the subway and the undergroung passages. It is also directly next to the Bell center and the PLace Bonevanture. Both can be accessed through the underground. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: enzo4me
Reviews.Content: Not only was the view amazing, but the bed was like sleeping on a cloud! Very clean, friendly staff, self serve parking as well as valet. The hotel itself seems to be an older style, but maintained very well. Significant walking distance from old Montreal. The restaurant at the hotel is very expensive, however there is a St. Hubert around the corner that does take out. Mini fridge is well stocked. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: 89VTGuy
Reviews.Content: Since this was my first time in Montreal and I don't speak French, I chose a name I can trust--Marriott. The staff was bilingual and friendly from the valet parking attendant to the front desk clerk, to the restaurant staff. Breakfast buffet was well stocked, even had salmon. Decor was heavy and some would consider it dated but it was clean. My view of adjacent park was nice with the snow. Staff readily made local eating recommendations. As indicated in other reviews, getting your car from valet is slow, but not a problem if you call Â½ hour ahead of time; alternatively the Metro stop is underneath. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff”
Reviews.Author: MapleLeafsur2
Reviews.Content: I highly commend the management staff for their professionalism, repsonsiveness and class. I'm a road-weary business traveller who flys continentally. I'm at the end of my tether often by the time I've crossed 3 time zones and hit 5 cities to check in to my last hotel. I can't praise the Marriott staff enough. I had an incident with my room that quite upset me. Their response/resolution (Joyce: thanks!) was so sincere, prompt and helpful that they've guaranteed my business throughout 2010. I definitely recommend this hotel. Forget the forced fuss and frivolity of other trying-to-out-do hotels and enjoy your stay at the Marriott Champlain.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Riverrider81
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights experiencing great valet service, sufficiently sized, clean west facing room, super concierge lounge. Only annoying thing was the concierge attendant was unusually loud in the morning with her tour/trip arrangement discussions with other guests. Staff was friendly with excellent service. Good location for downtown Crescent street night life and shopping. Block or so from to the train station too.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: beachbum2016
Reviews.Content: As It was my first time in Montreal, I was really looking forward to discover the city. The Marriot was a great place to stay for this! It's near by the Centre Bell, a street down from La Rue St. Catherine which was filled with shopping stores and boutiques. Arriving in the Marriot, it was such a delightful feeling. Everything was so nice and elegant. When we got to our room, the beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Internet was available upon request, which was a great. The room was a little small, but for the amount of time spent in there, it didn't matter much to me.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, but pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Cweis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chateau Champlain for 5 nights in August - he was in town for a conference and I worked remotely from the hotel for the week. The other reviews are on point - dated decor, rooms aren't especially large. I was fortunate to have a room with a view of the park across the street, so I spent the day people watching while I was on conference calls. Since I spent all day every day on the internet, I could tell that the wireless was flaky. Disappointing considering the charge. Location was OK -- it was a 15-minute walk to Vieux Montreal, which is where we ate most of our meals. Great location if you're going to a game at the Bell Center, though! All in all, this was as we expected. Montreal is a fabulous city, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel itself was so-so - looking forward to when they remodel the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LorenzSingapore
Reviews.Content: The hotel has Romanesque Revival (or Neo-Romanesque) style arch windows, at least in my room. Lobby area is also very stylishly decorated. I read in Wiki that this hotel was completed in 1967 in time for Montreal World Expo that year. You'll see the decor fits right in. Room and bed is very comfy. On the high floor overlooking Montreal downtown and St Lawrence river, it is definitely a steal for the Priceline price that I paid. Valet is only a few dollars more than self-parking, so I left it to valet. Not exactly near shopping district like St Catherine but an elevator at the lobby leads you to the underground city, and you can take the subway to St catherine 2 stops away. I roamed around and ended up in a train station with lots of food outlets.

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoggie123
Reviews.Content: the rooms were very nice, service was great. the $100/night rate was one of the best values ever. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby without the chic”
Reviews.Author: actisup
Reviews.Content: I had a room near the top of the hotel. The views outside were excellent, but the interior was just shabby and a little tired. Service was courteous but unfriendly. I would not choose this hotel for my next trip

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: GoneTrippn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Priceline rate and had good experience. First off, they put me on the 32nd floor with one of the best views of Montreal I've had. (Those of us who are Priceline regulars usually expect something on a low floor with a view of the parking lot.) Second, the bed was fantastic. Third, you are right on top of the Metro. Yes, the room was dated and the lobby seems a bit fuddy-duddy if you're under 40. But overall, I would not mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old-fashioned, out-dated, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MontrealAdvice
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights with my boyfriend. If we hadn't gotten a deal I would have felt ripped off, although the location was convenient. The lobby area is set up nicely, but the rooms are small and the TVs are old. For what people pay, you'd think it'd be more up-to-date. Pros: Location! Connected to the metro and underground city...although many hotels are. The staff was very friendly and quite helpful. The towels and linens appeared to be almost new (although one might argue that towels and such in decent shape would be REQUIRED in a 4 star hotel...). The view was nice, and the elevators were fast. Cons: There was what appeared to be a water stain on our ceiling, perhaps from the bathroom above? The stain was in the bedroom. The tub AND sink did not drain properly, and no one likes to stand in a pool of (cooling) water as they shower. The maid service was good, I've worked as a housekeeper at a 3-star hotel and typically know what to look for. For fun, I usually check the tops of picture frames to see what kind of dust was there. We were always told to do this where I worked. There was SO much dust it fell in clumps all over the bed! I was surprised. I recommend...IF you get a deal and aren't looking for anything too fancy.

Reviews.Title: “A Tired Lady :-(”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: As you step into the Marriott Chateau Champlain you can feel the history of this once Gem of the Canadian Pacific Hotel. About 13 years ago Ocean Properties of Portsmouth NH purchased this property and added it to the Marriott International Chain. As a typical Marriott customer I was excited to see that Marriott was finally adding quality hotels in Canada to their portfolio. We 13 years have passed and this hotel has become old and tired. This "Lady" needs a facelift. Unfortunately it does not make the list of my top hotels. The wall paper is peeling in rooms, the rugs in the hall are fading, the wood in the elevator is chipped and the staff is not too happy about it. According to one of the employees, the ownership has recently opened up a brand new Westin in Montreal and is paying all their attention to that property. How sad that after so many years as a CP hotel and then one of the first Marriotts in Canada this property is being left to become run down and tired. Even the Sheraton across the way went thru a major renovation last year... I think it is time for this property to become competitive like it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to date in presentation, but good service”
Reviews.Author: acc7
Reviews.Content: Hotel entrance was very grand but smelled like cleaning products consistently; the rooms were very old and out of date; rooms didnt have a dvd player and had a very old school tv; bathroom looked very homey, nothing elegant or beautfiul; it was clean; fair service; located in a central area in montreal; nothing really great or bad about the hotel; average compared to the other 4 to 5 star hotels ive stayed at. rooms really need to be renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was excellent”
Reviews.Author: harpercrane
Reviews.Content: Staff was great. Hotel was centrally located, clean and reasonable priced.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum member recommends”
Reviews.Author: J&MDAV
Reviews.Content: Clean, quick check in, great location, standard business services, access to underground tunnels to shops and metro â€“ bay windows in room helped with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: NewBrunswicker08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last month and I cannot say how well the staff was good at this hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is very close to Train station, Bell Center and off course shopping.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, GREAT Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewBTraveler
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this very brief.... I have NO idea what the complainers are talking about. There is nothing wrong with this hotel at all. It is a beautiful hotel in a great location. It sits on a Metro stop which is so convenient. The hotel offers great views of the city, is close to everything and in the middle of downtown. The service is amazing from check in, room service, concereige....everything! We loved this place and will definately go back. The ONLY thing I can fault the hotel on is the somewhat dated rooms and that's really pushing it. The rest of the hotel is beautiful, but the rooms could use a bit of a makeover, but are still very nice. Do NOT hesitate in booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with very friendly helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: 09happy
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews that I read on this site. The location is great! The best way to see Montreal is through its' metro system and this hotel served as a great location for doing just that. It is just 2 stops from Old Montreal and walking distance to some very hip restaurants. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I was pleasantly surprised by the gift I received when we checked in. Yes it was a grab by local shops to spend money at their stores but the thought was very nice. The concierge and door man were very helpful with suggestions of restaurants and how to get to sites. We did not eat at the hotel but the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The pool was a great size for our family and it was a nice touch to have an actual guard/attendant on duty. I will agree it is in need of a face lift as it is a bit out dated and the carpet is getting worn. But for us the price, location and friendly staff made our stay in Montreal very emjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: la2londonguy
Reviews.Content: Hotel directly connects to Metro system via lift and underground walkway. It is only 2 metro stops from Chinatown, and 4 metro stops from Berri-Uqam. Only 3 blocks south of St Katherine shopping street. So you can easily walk there in less than 10 min. The hotel is a bit old with a very small swimming pool (not as big as it is shown on the website). However, its location is so nice that I will stay here again for my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Option, Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: MBones7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on points as a layover on a long drive from Quebec City. Paid an upgrade fee for a junior suite on an upper floor which was well worth it. The location is very good if you want to be near Catherine, Peel, and Crescent Streets and the party scene. Not very convenient to Old Montreal and the immediate area is a bit seedy if you are staying with a young family. The hotel handles large crowds well, very fast elevators which is important for a high rise. I found the staff very friendly, competent, and efficient. Room service was also fast and friendly. As the other reviews pointed out, the rooms and lobby are a bit dated. Typical of a lot of city hotels, including smaller room size. Free wifi also a plus. Bottom line is you can probably do better in Montreal, but also much worse. Depending on the price you can get and your circumstances, it could be a good option.

Reviews.Title: “VERY disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MandyOwens
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Chateau for the last two nights of our honeymoon. The first three nights we were at the W Montreal which surpassed all of our expectations. Our room was upgraded to a suite on the top floor overlooking the park and everything was top-notch. We're loyal to the Starwood brand (W, Sheraton, Westin) but wanted to be a bit closer to the center of the city which is why we chose to switch hotels. I will never make that mistake again. This is by far the worst Marriott I have ever stayed at. This hotel is very old and dated (think curved shower curtain rod and a very dated television). When you're spending $200+ a night for a room, I expect only the best--not a clogged bathtub drain that had you wading in ankle-high water and a mattress that had you howling in pain because of its stiffness. We were promised "free" wireless internet, but the connection was so poor that I was only able to log on for a few minutes at a time. And no upgrade for us. We never expect a room upgrade, but it would have been nice to have a room on one of the higher floors since this was such a special occassion for us. Beware of the coffee makers in the room. My husband left with two stained dress shirts as the lids to the disposable coffee cups aren't made to size and fall off. Ridiculous! As was the inoperable remote control. The battery must have been dead--you think they would check these things periodically to make sure everything is the best it can be for their guests. Along with all of this, the service here is fair at best. When we walked up to the front entrance with our bags no one approached us to help us in. The three bellmen simply stood there and talked amongst themselves. Wow, what a change from the W where we were constantly being helped or greeted. Maybe the Marriott should take a lesson in customer service from them! There are hundreds of hotels in Montreal that will better meet your needs. Unless the Marriott is paying you to stay here, beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, slightly dated decor”
Reviews.Author: ImperftMe
Reviews.Content: As many other reviewers have pointed out, the decor is old and the rooms are on the small side. But as I was traveling alone with my 2.5yr old daughter, that was good news to me. Did she spill pizza sauce on the duvet cover and rug? Yes. Did she then spill an entire shaker of salt on the pizza sauce stain? Yes. Did she spill hot chocolate on both those stains the next morning? Yes. Did any of this matter? No. It was a huge relief to me to know the stains would probably go away once the hotel did a remodel. She loved the pool, although I wished there was at least a small shallow end for my sanity's sake, and she loved pushing the elevator buttons. The fact that we could get on the Metro from the lobby was also a plus since it meant less walking through traffic. The concierge was incredibly nice and helpful in identifying age-appropriate activities for us, and the room service was delivered relatively quickly, and I received a follow-up call to make sure everything was as ordered. When I called the front desk to ask about a DVD player to connect to the room tv, he was polite and honest and apologized when he told me the rental price was more than what it would cost to buy a new one. (Note: bring your own portable DVD player). The only weak link was the housekeeping staff who took over an hour to bring an extra blanket, but that may have been that one staff member. Overall, a really enjoyable visit with a great staff and a great rate. I would absolutely stay here again, and recommend to anyone except honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with a friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: SudCarolinaTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a terrific location in downtown Montreal. The metro and undergound shopping are accessible directly beneath the hotel. Many terrific sites are withing easy walking distance of the front door. My daughter had an urge to see a movie and a 22 theater cinema is located 3 short blocks away. The hotel is showing its age but it is well maintained and the friendly and helpful staff rendered this fact moot. My frequent business travel takes me to Marriott hotels in many locations and this staff is among the best I have experienced. It also provides one of the few full service Marriott's I have encountered with free internet access and includes a well run concierge lounge. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: RockfishHunter
Reviews.Content: If the price is right, you can't beat this hotel. I've noticed the pricing of this place varies wildly, sometimes you can get a better deal at a nicer hotel, but more often than not this hotel offers the best bang for your buck. First off, the location is phenominal. Right on top of the metro, easy walk to St. Catherine/Sherbrooke streets, easy walk to the nightlife on Crescent (go listen to my friends Solstice play at Hurleys!), and Old Montreal/Lower Plateau is even walkable on a nice day (or a quick ride on the metro). Rooms are very nice, a few things are a tad dated but are well kept and very clean. Beds are very comfortable. Staff has always been nice, especially the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “There is nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: H&B_love_to_travel
Reviews.Content: after reading some of the reviews of this hotel, i was a bit hesitant to stay there. just goes to prove that you can't satisfy everyone. there is nothing wrong with this hotel! we have travelled quite a bit and like to stay in the nicest place we can afford. at $129 through travelzoo, this hotel was well worth the money. we had a wonderful view from our 31st floor room, comfy king size bed, and had no problem with any noise. we did not try the restaurant, but although a bit pricey for our budget, the menu looked fantastic. i have no idea why anyone would say the lobby looked "tired"?? it was immaculate, staff very friendly and helpful also. we would not hesitate to stay there again as long as we got another great deal like we did. another major plus: the metro runs directly under this hotel, making getting around super easy. especially nice on rainy days.

Reviews.Title: “Aging, good value, convenient”
Reviews.Author: dcadog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is showing its age and a bit of recession cost-cutting. We had two stays with durations of 1 day and 3 days. We preferred to stay downtown with a short walk to the old town. Rooms were dated, furniture scratched, non-working "free" internet, noisy doors that slam shut, cracked sink. Main big plus of this hotel is the Bonaventure Metro access directly from the lobby, and a short underground walk to the train station and underground Montreal. Plus the prices were a bit below hotels in this class and convenience. Service was excellent in the concierge lounge, where we enjoyed good cont. breakfasts - ample and varied (fruit, meats, cheese, lox etc). The hotel staff is apparently well aware of the poor/non-existent wireless internet connection. They had excuses aplenty, and it may be why the internet service is free in this Marriott. Then I found out that some rooms have ethernet/T1 connections, which worked fine after we changed locations. Be sure to request one of these rooms if you need a web connection. Without the internet hassle, I would rank the service as a 4. No nearby restaurants of note, but a short metro ride to the Sherbrooke Station will take you to two our favs - L'Express and Pied de Cochon. Biking in Montreal is an urban marvel and is the best way to learn the city's layout. For all the bikers or beginners, get yourself down to Ã‡a Roule MontrÃ©al in the Old Port, 27 de la Commune East. Plenty of flat and hilly options from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great view...but outdated”
Reviews.Author: Kanada82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built for EXPO67 (so says the plaque out front). It looks as though they have tried to update the common areas, but havent given much thought to updating the rooms. Wouldnt have stayed here had we not got a great deal with Travelzoo (150CAD/night inc. all taxes/fees). Room was otherwise spacious and clean. Front desk was friendly - found the bellmen too pushy though (as soon as we pulled up, they took our bags out of trunk - no option to just park ourselves in front of hotel, and check in). Very close to the hussle and bussle of downtown, but not loud.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Pepysp
Reviews.Content: Good attentive check in. Room was fine, spacious and very clean. Bathroom just a little tired, but otherwise good. Service was good and the staff I met all smiled were attentive. Good value and I would recommend the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Rina9Chicago
Reviews.Content: Before our arrival, I emailed the hotel to confirm our reservations and request our rooms [4 rooms with 15 family members all together] to be close to each other and Herve Lecault [of Reservations] took care of that .We were happy that our rooms were almost next to each other. We wanted a Quebec City tour arranged, emailed the Concierge few days before our arrival and Pierrette Page [Concierge] took care of that. People at the front desk, Bell Boys, etc...were very helpful. Location of the hotel is walking distance to everything. Few blocks from St. Catherine Street [major shopping, restaurants areas], 20-30 min. walk to Old Montreal, Notre Dame Basilica and Chinatown. Access to Underground City and the Metro is right behind the Concierge desk. They have a decent swimming pool and fitness center. The rooms were clean and had great beds/linens. We're very happy that we took the 12-hr Quebec City tour. It was well worth the $70 [per person] that we paid. It was about 3 hr bus ride each way from Montreal. Quebec City was just so pretty and very rich in culture. It's a must see. Old Montreal is another one that you don't want to miss. I recommend that you take a Montreal City tour on your first day so you can pick the places you need to go back to on the following days during your stay. Eating out in Montreal is expensive and unlike Toronto, they only take Canadian $. Don't exchange your money at the airport, go to Old Montreal or Downtown Montreal to get a good deal. Regarding restaurants: Guido & Angelina [Italian] had decent food so as 3 Brasseurs in Old Montreal BUT Alexandre [French] on Peel Street is one restaurant to AVOID-food was mediocre, expensive and service was very slow. For souvenir shopping, there's plenty of shops in Old Montreal area, especially the ones close to Notre Dame Basilica. You can even find Quebec City items from this places. We had a great time and we plan to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Bel_sped52
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of 6. We had a great time. The Concierge was very helpful and printed out maps when we asked how to get to a certain place. We had breakfast in the restaurant but never tried the nicer restaurant. It is very conveniently located and we never ran out of things to do. Be sure and visit Quebec City while you are there. It is even more beautiful than Montreal. We went by train and paid $134.00 per person. That seemed a little steep and there might be a less expensive way to go. It was a three hour trip and very well worth it! The shopping in Quebec was extraordinary! I can't say anything negative about the hotel. It was all very nice. The people were friendly and I would not hesitate to go back. We were on the 16th floor and had a really neat view of some other pretty buildings in the area. Out friend had an awesome view of the St. Lawrence River. Take a double decker bus tour....relatively cheap and very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: IntlEconTraveler
Reviews.Content: As soon as you get in to the lobby you will start thinking "why did I pick this hotel." The hotel needs a lot of remodeling. The carpet in the hallways and rooms is dirty, the desk chairs inside my room were shinny from the dirt and the bathroom looked like it hadn't been renovated in at least 30 years. The TV inside my room was older than me and it only had a few channels. The same goes with the sheets from the bed, they had holes from over washing and over use. Breakfast is super expensive and believe is not worth it. The only highlight from the hotel is its location, other than that for its price its not worth it. Try the Hilton or the InterContinental they are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriott - good access to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: windsurfer5230
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great trip to Canada. Five of the eight nights we were there were in Montreal at this Marriott. We were upgraded to the 31st floor with a spectacular lofty view of the city (my Wife stays at lots of Marriotts) This is a very busy Marriott, and as another reviewer recently noted - they host high school functions, which can make it even busier. Access to downtown Montreal is great from this Marriott - there is a Metro station directly underneath it, and you can get into the "underground" through the Metro station. In fact, for those travellers who really want to know how to get back to the Marriott through the underground , I'd recommend starting from the Marriott instead of trying to find your way back to it from somewhere else in the city ! We had both great and so-so service from the staff at this hotel. While the concierges are generally friendly (and bilingual) , we did encounter one with "L'attitude". She seemed to be just too busy to help. On the flip side, we had a server in the restaurant one morning who was fantastic. We were in Montreal for Canada Day (July 1st) and enjoyed the wonderful Canadian festivities, including a great parade. Most of the Montreal locals we met were super friendly. While there we saw the gargantuan botanical gardens and insectarium - both of which were fun and interesting. We also brought our rollerblades as we heard about good biking/rollerblading in the city. We went out to I'sle Notre Dame to the formula one track via twice during our visit for rollerblading. The first time we skated from the waterfront along the LaChine Canal trail - this was a mistake as the trail is rather hazardous on blades (it would be fine on a bike). The pavement is uneven in some section and the bridges are downright dangerous. We found that taking the Metro to/from the island was the way to go. You can board right under the Marriott on the Orange line, switch to the yellow line and it's the next stop. About a 30 minute ride including switching trains. Rollerblading on the track was a unique experience - you've just got to be careful of the bikers who are blazing past. The Montreal Casino is on this island too - probably the cleanest Casino I've ever seen , both inside and outside. I don't think smoking is permitted. The gardens on the outside of the Casino are immaculate. We also went to the Montreal Jazz Festival during our vist which runs the first two weeks in July. Saw Jamie Cullum and Chris Botti at La Place des Arts. Both concerts were great. The free concerts were fine too - although be prepared to stand. Just an FYI - the Place des Arts is accessible via the Metro and through the underground if the weather isn't good. We ate at several restaurants during our stay. The 3 Brassileurs (?) restaurants around town are a dependable lunch spot as are the many cafes in the old city. We also ate one night at La Montee (de Lait) which was much more expensive than I ever imagined for such little food. The presentation was elegant and it was probably one of the trendiest restuarants we've ever visited.
